text: Kapsel is drinking an Oude Kriek (2009) by Geuzestekerij De Cam Pestkowo wiśniowe, dzikie, fajnie kwaśne.

Pours a purple body with a thin pink head. Aroma full of cherries with a sour touch. Taste is quite acidic with a very well balanced fruity finish of cherries.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pitcher pour at the brewery. Pours out a nice ruby red topped with a small pink head. Nose is nice tart cherries oak a nice funky kick. Taste is more of the nice cherries oak barrel forward tartness and funk.

Bottle. Bottled Jan 2006; Drank Jan 2009 - Dark cherry red/ruby in colour. Poured opaque. Little carbonation; fairly flat. Very cherry-fruity, tangy, lots of tart cherries, lemon. Acidic, sour. Oaky, woody. Earthy, yeasty, funky. Sour, dry finish. Lovely Fruity Lambic! (2009-01)
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Wyśmienity Kriek.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.

Bottle. Pours a cloudy ruby with medium frothy pink head that lasts. The aroma is strong funk, cherry skin, wood. Medium body, nice funk, oak, cherry, light acidity, nice tartness, really enjoyed this.

Poured from a 750 ml bottle of unknown vintage (likely 2012 or 2013). 
Aroma is moderately fruity with bright cherry notes including cherry pie and juice. Light tropical fruit notes. Light tannins and cherry skin with light oak. Light leafy, herbal phenolic notes with hints of an earthiness. 
Pours a moderately dark, purple-red with a medium small, medium thick, pink head that recedes steadily to the edges where it lingers. No lacing or legs. 
Flavor is slightly sweet with a moderate acidity that is well rounded. Light oak notes with medium light herbal and earthy phenolics. Moderate cherry notes with lots of cherry pie and juice notes. Light tropical fruit and lemon. Light tannins and skin notes. 
Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. 
Overall, a nice oude kriek, but I have had better bottles. The cherry and oak notes are nice, but the earthy and herbal funk notes could be a bit stronger.

UPDATED: JUN 17, 2017 Rami Rami is drinking an Oude Kriek by Geuzestekerij De Cam at Apartamenty Saska nad JezioremPestkowe, intensywne, taninowe, mocno kwasne, klasaOcena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).Rami Rami is drinking an Oude Kriek (2009) by Geuzestekerij De Cam at Wał Gocławski

Pestkowo-wiejsko- dzikie. Agresywny aromat, zwlaszcza szocik drozdzowy. Srednio kwasny. Srednio wytrawny. Ale solidna obora sumarycznie ryli

Thanks Huhzubendah for sharing the bottle! Poured into a tulip glass showing a translucent red wine and barely any head. 

The nose shows strong, ripe, and sweet bing cherry forwardness. 

The palate is lightly carbonated and medium bodied. Once again showing strong, juicy, and ripe bing cherries yet completely dry. This flavor permeates throughout akin to a jolly rancher. Absolutely fantastic.

Bottle shared at t Klooster. Murky dark ruby with short lasting pink head. Lots of sour cherries, almonds and marzipan, light yoghurt, hay, quite some funk, soft mineral notes in the finish. Over medium sour and very light sweetness and bitterness. Medium bodied with soft carbonation. Pretty good.

Bottle at Klooster Delft, shared. Murky red poor with offwhite head. Sweet and sour cherry, cherrry stone, yoghurt, horse poop. Medium lactic sour. Medium body, soft carbonation. Woodglue-like fruity woody sour finish.

Bottle shared at Klooster. Murky ruby with no head. Notes of cherries, macerated cherries and sherry, lambic funk. Very tart, lactic, with only a hint of sweetness. Medium body, low carbonation and a tart finish.

9/VIII/16 - 75cl bottle from Geers (Oostakker) @ home - BB: n/a, bottled: 2009 (2016-819) 
Very murky cloudy deep ruby red to purplish beer, small creamy pink to orange head. Lots of residue, both in the glass (its like freshly squeezed fruit juice!) and on top of the foam. Holy moly, how many cherries are in this bottle? :o Aroma: very fruity, krieken all the way! Funky wood notes, bit lemony. MF: soft carbon, medium to full body. Taste: so much krieken! An overload of cherries, yet nothing sweet or artificial at all!! Little bitter, some tannins, soft acidity, some almonds. Aftertaste: wood notes, bit sourish, little bitter in the finish, shitload of cherries again. What a beer!

750 ml bottle shared at the Hoppy Pub, Thessaloniki, courtesy of skullgeorge. Hazy ruby red color with off white head. Yeasty fruity aroma, barnyard, cherries, light wood. Light sweet and heavy acidic fruity taste. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

Appearance: Dark red down color with very little head

Aroma: Rich red wine with prominent but not overwhelming cherry. A bit like cherry Robitussin. 

Taste: Rich and chewy cherry malt with some cotton candy. Really pronounced oaky finish has some cotton candy

Overall: This was a 2016 so still many years for more complexity to develop. May be a bit too medicinal for some folks.

Purple. Moldy mouse cork aromas. Tart dry cork taste. Faint cherry and wood. This is not right compared to other rating. Taste like cork in a wine bottle. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle, 2009 vintage. Pours a deep cherry red body with a short-lived white head. Nose is red berries, stable funk, cherries, apple vinegar and hints of wood, hay and lemon juice. Taste is tart cherries up front, then an assault of lemon juice, apple vinegar and lactic sourness takes hold of the palate. In the back, cherry pits and dark fruity tones make themselves known. Medium to light body, dry finish, high carbonation. Amazing stuff, really mouth-puckering sour but with just enough cherry flavor to be an outstanding specimen of the kriek breed of sours.

Bottle shared at the level 42, 24/05/2016. Many thank to the dirty Daniel for this one. A murky plum pink coloured pour with a small part no head. Aroma is tart plum, berry, raspberry, plastic, some sugars. Flavour is composed tart underripe plum, raspberry, smokey cherry, semi sweet, berry, tangy, hint of vinegar. Palate is semi sweet and sour, moderate carbonation, tangy. Good stuff.
Bottle @ Haket Pub. Reddish amber with no head. Fruity and acidic tones. Fruit, sour and stable. Medium to light body with a long dry/ acidic finish.

750ml bottle at home in Richmond to celebrate a new job. As De Oude Cam Exclusief Oude Kriek, 6.5%, bottled Jan 2009. Thin red pour to form a purple cherry red, clear, sparkling beer with a brief pink head. Aroma is intense cherry, thin red wine like merlot, meaty, funk, a little swimming pool and dried out manure. A lovely balance between cherry and lambic sherbet dirtiness. Body is full, oily, soft carbonation. Taste is intense sour cherries, sherbet, cherry Tangfastics, red lemonade, lemon juice. Quenching fruits and not overly sour.  Aftertaste just keeps going.  Very indulgent. Fantastic.
750 ml. shared bottle. Thanks Nikos! Pours reddish purple with a decent pink head. Aroma of cherries, fruit, and funk. Taste is tart cherries, fruit, funk, and some vinegar. Very, very good.

(bottle, 2009) hazy ruby colour with a frothy pink head. aroma of sour cherries and vanilla, with lots of spring foliage, a hint of multivitamin juice, campfire embers and lemons. flavour is more cherries and lemon juice, again rather leafy, with a touch of walnuts and unripe mango in the rather tart finish. medium-bodied with fizzy carbonation.
Cloudy ruby color with fast disappearing foam. Fruity nose. Full and fine carbonation, with a strong fruity sourness. Bonedry finish with a sour and fruity aftertaste.

750ml Bottle at home shared with myself, 26th March 16. Pours dark pink red. Aroma is cherry, cherry skin and stone, funky. Taste is sour cherry pulp, red wine vinegar, pretty tart finish, no sign of the 6.5. Quite an experience. Great stuff from De Cam
Purple color with pink head. Aroma is cherries, lemons, not so much funk. Taste is sour, cherries, dry, mouth-puckering. Very sour, but good stuff.
Bottle, courtesy of SinH4. Well carbonated, less cherry, very very sour, pinching palate. Very pure cherry though, borderline artificial.
Ik drink ontzettend graag Geuze, maar deze vond ik echt te zoet. Doet echt onder voor toppers zoals de Kriek van Cantillon en 3 Fonteinen.

29 Jan 2016, bottle. Bottled Jan 2009. Light scarlet/Ruby. Nose is insane! Ive never had a sour beer like this. Actually my first beer from a blender. Nose is over ripe cherries and hints of sweet nail polish remover. Dry thin body and mildly fizzy. Wow. So much going on here. Mild, dry cherry sour, hints of nail polish, some barnyard funk and balsamic. Wow. So much fun. Im sure the experience is blowing my mind.
Bottle. Dark red pour, with a pinkish head. Sweet cherries, sour, tart cherries, lemon, leather, light funk, hay, and fairly strong oak. Tasty.

Bottled in 2005. Poured crystal-clear reddish-orange with no head. The aroma picked up sour cherry vinegar, oak, and oak with a bit of age.. really nice! The flavor found similar, with lots of lemon zest, vinegar, and oak.. sour all the way through.. well-balanced and tasty. Sour and well-balanced.. low carbonation.. really good!

Bottle. Pours ruby deep red, haze, pink head. Aroma is funky, cherry, fruits, raspberry, brett, funk, leather and red currant. Taste is equal. Fruity berries, tart, light weak finish. Fruity aftertaste though. Light dry.

December 15, 2015. Bottle at home, bottled january 2009 according to the label but probably later...
Ruby red with a small fizzy and quickly dissipating pinkish head. Aroma is fruit forward with tart cherries, lemon juice, leaves, some funk, barnyard, hints of sweet berries. Taste is sour, fruity, light funky. Finish is sour cherries, lemon juice, very light berry sweetness, light barnyard notes with a touch of oak and leather. Medium bodied, dry texture, soft to average carbonation. 
Very good, fruity and well balanced acidity.
Une superbe kriek à la robe rubis brillante. Un nez superbe de puissance et de complexité et une bouche tout en tension et fraîcheur. Une très grande Kriek

Bottle, vintage 2009. Fantastically deep and well integrated, complex bouquet. Sour cherries, other sour, red fruit, light horseblanket, hay and farmyard funk. Sour, crisp, deep and rich beer. Excellent stuff.
Wonderful stuff, very tart, yet still with a lot of fruit character, ripe cherries that blend in well with the overall tartness of the beer. World class.
Bottle at home. Pours murky red with a pink head. Aroma of funk, tart, sour cherry, light wood. Taste is sour cherry, funk, light barn, wood. Quite dry with quite a complex taste.

Bottle. Cork says bb 2039, label a crossed out 2009. Who knows, but youd guess this is recent because the cherries are a big presence. Deep clear red with a pink head that is soon gone. Brooding cherry aroma with somewhat medicinal wood and herbal notes. Taste is unexpected vinous with a palate thats more acid and seemingly tannic than sour. Earthy with cherries, blackberries, almonds. Like biting down to the stone of a really fat sour cherry. so full of cherries but theyre seamlessly integrated into the beer overall. deeper cherry flavours than any other Kriek Ive had and a very fine beer.
Bottle. Hazy deep red body with a medium pink head. Cherries, vinegar, yeast, marzipan, citric, blood orange, tart, light dusty. Sour finish. Very good.

Bottle shared by a friend. Poured a dark red colour with a slight pink head on top. Sweet cherries upfront, hay, slight citrus, and a hint of grains, musky vinegar and horseblanket. Pretty sour as a kriek. Sour cherries and raspberries. Incredible stuff

750mL corked & caged Champagne bottle. Bottled Jan 2009 - although its been crossed out(?)
Stunning looking beer really - deep scarlet body, touch of hazy, holds a very tightly packed bright pink head.
Aroma is quite vinous, not overly pungent but complex - black cherry, almond, getting ripe mulchy Pinot Noir character in there too, faint toasty oak (newish barrel?), touch of vanilla there, acetic acid twang, subtle leesy cheesy note.
Light bodied, lively carbonation, racy acidity thins things out but isnt overbearing, seems a touch malic, not as aggressively acetic/vinegary as many.
Tart cherry on the body, not sour cherry, actually reasonably ripe cherry flavour, the acidity is coming from elsewhere. Vinous once again - light bodied Pinot-esque, could pass for a Rosé of some description, but theres that touch of oak vanillin & toast, and faint funky notes of aged hard cheese & barnyard. Drawn out finish, lingering herbal quality (pips? stalks?).
A rather elegant, sophisticated Lambic. Plenty of fruit in there, but theres plenty of the underlying beer to appreciate.
Blood red with aromas of funk and apple, floral and slighty metallic. Balanced palate mildy sour with a medium winey body. Great beer that really opens with time in the glass.

"2009 Jan" bottle, not sure of actual date. Murky pink, not very saturated and a bit grayish, weak head.

Aroma very complex, big almond notes, cherry, redcurrants, red wine like, vanilla, oak, with a layer of funk. Tastes the same, like a compote of almond and cherry skins with a sparkling sourness and cheesey leathery aftertaste.

2009, 750ml. Alberto and Mortlach, stunning! Deep cola red, pearly rose head. Dissipates to cream. Wow, fantastic old, funky barnyard. Great, drying funk, so appetizing. Cherry is secondary to tannic, young red wine quality. One of the tastiest beers Ive had in recent memory. Such a treat.

Bottle shared. Pours lightly cloudy red with a pink head. Aroma of tart cherries, red berries, light funk and oaky notes. Flavour is light sweet and over moderate sour. Light medium bodied with soft carbonation.
Reddish color pink head. Sour cherries, lemony sourness, yeast, earthy funk. Tasty!!!
Bottle. Pours hazy pinkish orange with little head. Tart and acidic, with some funky dusty notes, oak, and relatively mild cherry fruitiness. Very drinkable; good stuff.

Courtesy of umich03jm and tectactoe
Bottle: The aroma consists of tart hurry, lemon, and moderate funk. It pours a purplish brown with a small pink head that quickly fades to a minimal film outlined by a thin ring. The flavor starts with a quick dose of cherry. It quickly turns tart cherry in the finish with moderate sour lemon and funk. Its light-medium bodied with mild carbonation.
Bottle thanks to angst! Aroma are sour cherry skins, lots of oak, some grass, light barnyard. Taste moderately and moderately tart. Lots of cherries, dry barnyard, strong grass/hay. Love it

750 ml bottle at home, thanks TimVim! Hazy red with pink head. Aroma of cherry, piths, light perfume, bitter almond extract and light tart notes. Taste is tart, sour, cherry, cherry piths, a bit lemonade with a tart fruity berry finish. Nice!

Big 750ml bottle kindly shared by Sigmund at Cardinal. Dark reddish body. Patchy surface. Dry aroma of berry skins. Mid-tart cherry and oak to the taste character. Woody. Long lived tartness of berries to the finish. Decent cleanser, not a favourite though. (Stavanger 18.06.2015).

Delt 0,75 l flaske på Cardinal. Burgunder matt kropp med et lyst skumlag som fester seg langs glasskanten. Deilig svovel, kirsebær og bær i nesa. Syrlig, salt og fruktig med kisebær og et hint av tyttebær. Deilig lett snerpende i munnen med en lett kropp. Forfriskende og vidunderlig.

Bottle shared by someone wonderful at wtwba. deep red color. nose is wonderful kriek goodness of cherry, wood, some funk. Tastes of deep cherry, wood, funky barn, some lemon, and blood. lively palate deep finish. great

750ml bottle 2009 vintage pours bright cloudy red with medium head. Nose is super funky, lots of barny horse, cowshit, musty barrel, mixed with juicy cherry spice jam. Taste is full of sweet funky cherry, fruit spice, old barn wood, barnyard, medium acidity. Finishes with sweet funky tart cherry and berry jam, funky barrel, horse stable, wood spice. Amazing at 6 years in the bottle. One of the best krieks Ive had.

2008 Vintage. Pours a deep ruby color with a finger of pinkish foam. Tons of funky cherry notes still pungent and apparent with 6 years on this. Really shines with layers of spicy cherry pits, tart skins juicy cherry funk and undertones of basement must, wet wood, barnyard nuances. Great acid level !

0,75 bottle from Mortlach the Great. Grazie! Pours a reddish dark bright color, pinkish pearly foam. Nose: terrific! Wild mint, red fruit, undergrowth, red fruit. Mouth: Wild and balanced, cherries, funk, red fruit, frizzy hidden carbonation. So good! Grazie Luca!!!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

(De Cam Oude Kriek) Bottle 750 ml at home, served into a tulip,bottled in 2009 according to label, ABV 6.5%,
Bright red coloured liquid, small and thin pink-ish head, disappearing fast, no lacing.
Great aroma of cherries, wood, cork. Slightly sour taste with lots of cherries, wood, dried leaves. Thin body, good carbonation. 
Pretty tasty stuff this one, even better than more sought after bottles I dare say.

Bottle from De Cam in Gooik.
Clear red color with a head that dissapears quickly.
Beautiful taste, dry, medium sour, sour cherrys, oak taste, creamy aftertaste.

UPDATED: JAN 27, 2016 750ml bottle, with 2009 botteling date. Beautiful clear red color. Aroma is light acidity, oak, cherry, funky, leather. Taste is medium sour, young sour cherries, oak barrel flavors. Finish is dry, tart with lemon aftertaste. This is great complex beer. During drinking beer flavors fantastic open up.

750ml bottle @Mad For Beer (Rome). Amazing "pigeons blood" ruby color with a massive pinkish/off-white foam. Aroma is cherry & red fruits, mentuccia, undergrowth, fantastic! Flavour is very sour, fresh, fruity with a perfect dry end. Medium body, medium carbonation. A pure gem!

Pours a beautiful, seductive, dark red. A one-finger pinkish-red head forms and quickly dissipates. Fresh cherry jam. Candied lemon. Funktastic basement. Tart lemon is dominant. Cherry flavor is underlying and very subtle. Refreshing, but relatively sour. Medium-bodied. Low carb.
Very drinkable despite its sourness. Its like a tart lemonade with a hint of cherry juice added. Not bad, but not mind blowing.

How: Bottle, 2005 vintage.
Where: Akkurat, Stockholm.
Appearance: Dark red colour with almost no head.
Aroma: Cherries, sour, vinegar.
Body: Medium body, no carbonation.
Flavour: Cherries, acidic, berries, sour, vinegar.
Väldigt röd färg utan något skum. Doftar syrligt och massor med körsbär! Väldigt syrlig smak med mycket körsbär och ek. Riktigt bra lambic!

0.75L bottle from Belgian e-shop

Pours medium to deep red with small to average head, dissipates quickly. Aroma is cherry, light lactic tartness, hints of funkiness, framboise, the cherry part of the aroma is very complicated and amazing, some cherry marmalade too. Maybe they use both fresh fruit and cherry concentrate? Cant wait to taste this brew!
Quite tart but mainly lactic tartness, unripe cherry, very light notes of funkiness, very nice but not as complex as the aroma. Aftertaste has quite strong but smooth tartness with some light earthy notes.
One of the best Kriek, cheers!

Bottle thanks to Bursprak! Pours a deep red with a pink, short lasting head. Aroma has vinegar, tart cidric fruit, but only hints of cherry. Taste has some funk, is very sour. Cherry stone bitterness in the end. Vinegar, but again fairly little, but deep dark cherry. As it gets some heat you get more though, and more oak and vanilla as well. Medium carbonation and sharp, sour burning body.
Bottle. Purple with no head. Funky lambic aroma, some cherry. Taste is very lambicy, funky as it comes, some cherry. Nice and sour

Mandag i annen ruler! Hvor ellers får man så mange gode øl i passelige doseringer på en kveld? Etter fine humle- og maltopplevelser fikk vi Oud Beersel Framboise og tenkte at her er Nirvana. Men nå viste det seg at vi bare hadde stått ved porten. Champagenkorken vippes (nesten) lydløst av , der er ikke antydning til skum i glasset men nesegrevet fylles av en intens kirsebæraroma. En vidunderlig sur syrlighet med astringent ettersmak gjør bildet komplett. Når man først har fått smaken på lammbic kan man like gjerne flytte til Belgia.

75cl bottled in 2009. Brewer told me it can also be a 2010 or 2011 batch, as they use the same labels out of cost efficiency. Pours deep burgundy red with little head, fades quickly. Aroma is subtle, cherries, barnyard, citrus, cheese. Tart with an acidic touch. Full on cherry flavour, pretty sirupy, medium carbonation. Beautiful zesty and earthy aftertaste that lingers on the tastebuds. Softer than fresh because of the aged lambic.

UPDATED: MAR 14, 2016 Shared bottle at Cardinal, Stavanger. Pours hazy dark ruby with very small white head. Aroma of horse stable, wood, leather, cherries, vegetables, some sulphur. Taste very sour with cherries.

UPDATED: MAR 14, 2016 Bottle shared at Mi2 at Cardinal 26.01.15 and 14.03.16. Bottled in 2009 (or later). Bright, clear red. Small off-white head. Characteristic lambic and cherry aroma. Similar taste. Sour and dry. Very good!

Bottle from 2009 @ dangerous bottleshare 5.0 . Pours ruby red with with a tiny head. Aroma of vinegar, sweet cherries, sweeter oak, funk and some tartness as well. The taste is acidic and very tart with notes of cherry, vinegar, stable and some eatable multivitamins. Pretty laid back Kriek which is more subtle in terms of fruitiness (due to the age) - but still a very solid and interesting Kriek!

Bottle split 5 ways as part of Dangerous Bottleshare 5.0. Deep red pour with some white head. Loads of cherries! Taste is fairly tart with an acidic edge that blends well with the cherries. Very different from the Cantillon Krieks but very good in its own way!

Bottle, 2009, thanks to bursprak. Cheers! Pours slightly hazy ruby red with a small pink head. Aromas of very tart cherries, lots of sour notes, vinegar, some acidity, funky notes, some sweeter oaky notes. Taste is pretty sour up front, tart cherries, funk, hay, straw, acid, vinegar, sweeter notes, oak. Very nice!
per amanti delle kriek, bevuta al The Drunken Duck a Vicenza, schiuma color rosa carico, profumatissima, la birra spicca in acidità per poi far posto alla frutta, davvero ottima
Goût de lambic qui sattenue pour laisser la place au goût de cerise qui reste en arrière goût. Le goût de cerise reste faible, mais sympa
Lambic aroma straight from the bottle. Amazing red colour. No foam. First in the mouth is lambic dominant. Second of fresh cherry. Aftertaste of cherry peel. Definitely soft. Not too sour.
Pours a light red color with pinkish head. Light cherries and berries on the nose, and some tartness/funk; follows onto the palate. Very light, but complex lambic. Very good.

At tall Matts house with Matt, Matt, garrett, and respective chicks. Pours bright red, a little flat. Delicate sour, delicious, authentic fluffy cherries, bursting with flavor. Taste is funky, medium subdued tartness, such beautiful funky lambic notes. Love. This is on of the best fruited lambics I have had.
09 bottle. Rooby tones, small pink head. Mild aroma. Flavor is very tart cherries, fruity, tasty. Would love to try it fresh.

Has a fizzy, small head, and a slightly hazy dark red color with ruby hints to it.

Funky barnyard aromas unfold along lots of leather, and hints of sour yoghurt, wrapped up by a gently cherry fruitiness.

Wooden, bready malts with damp hops stand against a super-dry, acidic sourness. Cherries blend well into the sour aspect of the beer, providing a mellow sweetness, while adding more depth to the wooden malts as well. At the same time, the cherries dont seem to be too young and pungent fruity, but with a ripe fermented touch and lots of stone qualities to them. The uprising sourness during the middle part is defined by an immense dryness, illustrated by cherry fruitiness. This brew has a great balance, with a very well defined, intense sourness, accompanied by an earthy, complex cherry note.

0,75 pullo@ OPP. Samea syvän kirsikanpunainen. Tuoksussa todella paljon kirsikkaa ja happamuutta, aavistus maltaita. Maussa kirsikkaa, todella hapanta ja kirpeää! Huh! Arvostan, mutta en maksaisi tästä itse.
0,75l bottle @ One Pint Pub. Pours ruby red with a low pink head. Aroma is sour cherries with a hint of malts. Flavor is sour cherries with some malts. Great!

Refrigerated 75 cl corked and caged bottle poured into a glass. Deep red with small off-white head. Aroma is light cherries with a hint of urea, medium body, medium/low carbonation, and little small-bubble lacing. Taste is nice rich tart cherry. Would like to have this again.
Bottle. Pours a hazy purple with a white head of foam. The aroma has big cherry presence. Fruity funk. Taste is moderately sour. Nice fruit taste. Medium body and medium to high carbonation.
Deep red color with a pink color. Lovely cherry and some marzipan. Nice body. Fine balance. Although very dry. Cherry and marzipan flavor. Lovely fresh and tasty fruit ale. [Bottle at rlgk plaza]

Bottle at USA comes to Göteborg 2014. Hazy reddish/ruby beer with a small head. Sourish fruity aroma, cherries, raspberries, tart, rubber notes, strawberries, funky, hay, some citrus. Sourish cherry flavor, tart, rubber notes, raspberries, funky, citrus, gun powder, some grass. Extremely refreshing, very drinkable lambic.

750ml bottle served in a snifter glass.
Bottled in January 2009.
A: Nice pop when opened. Pours a beautiful reddish cloudy colour forming a small pinkish creamy and bit molasses head. Medium retention and many lingering glasses formed and left in the glass
S: Classic fruity Lambic. Great perfume of cherries. A delicious juice of cherries with also delicious notes of oak. A bit metallic. Belgian Lambic yeasts
T: Perfect taste. Slightly sweet upfront. Cherry bomb. Excellent notes of cherries. Absolutely delicate taste. Not too sour and not too sweet as well. Cherry vinegar. Very balanced. Oak. Earthy Belgian Lambic yeasts
M: Medium body and carbonation. Cherry juice aftertaste 
O: Excellent drinkability. If you are looking for a perfect Kriek, youve just found one...
[ BA Review @ 2/20/2014 ]

75 cl bottle from Etre Gourmet, sampled on September 23, 2014 in Ludvika.Hazy reddish brown color, pink head. Cherry, pips/stone/seed, acidic scent. Acidic to sour taste, acidic aftertaste. Medium mouthfeel to fizzy, no bitterness.

bottle shared @ Pre Borefts tasting 
Thin pink head. Hazy pink pour. Aroma sour berries. Sour cherry taste.
Poured medium raspberry with no head. Aroma of sour berries. Medium body, flavour as the aroma.

Bottle 2006. Poured hazy reddish color with an average frothy reddish head that was mostly lasting with good lacing. Moderate to heavy complex sour cherry aroma. Medium body with a sticky texture and soft carbonation. Heavy sour cherry flavor with a medium to heavy tart sour finish of long duration. Sour refreshing brew.

375 ml bottle shared with the group. Pours a cloudy reddish color with no head. The aroma and flavor have tart, funky cherry, wood, acidic but smooth drinking. This was an 06 bottle and didnt have much carbonation but the flavor was very good.

375 ml bottle to taster (January 2006 vintage; shared by alexsdad06). Looks good for its age; a cloudy cherry with bubbly white lacing. Smells good too; cherries, funk, and oak. Tastes like it smells with a pleasantly tart mouthfeel. This may be the only sour with little to no carbonation that Ive ever truly enjoyed. The complexity is stunning.

Bottle at home from Belgiuminaboxbottled 2009hazy crimson with pink tinged white lacing. Sharp acidic lemon sherbet, Dusty, cherry drops, some dry Brett and peppermint notes on swirling. Lively fine carbonation, citric acid tartness, artificial cherry, residual sweetness earthy dryness. More acidity in finish.

UPDATED: NOV 9, 2014 Tasted from a ten year old bottle I found in a forgotten corner of the cellar today, must have been one of the first batches.  Pours a beautiful deep ruby red colour glowing in the autumn sun, clear; head formation is limited due to its age (and style) but with gentle forcing, a loose, milky, pale beige head appears (not a trace of pink) with quite good retention.  Old lambic aroma with sour cherries abounding, apart from hints of sundried tomatoes, raspberry vinegar, unsweetened yoghurt, very old sherry or madera, musty cellar, dried lemon peel, earth, dust, damp cloth, passion fruit, raw red cabbage, sweat.  Taste immediately very estery and fruity, sour cherries drenched in red wine, mellowish lactic acid, red grapefruit, soft carbonation but still some champenoise tingling on the tongue, barnyard funkiness, old sherry, Brett leather effect becoming increasingly stronger in the finish, which is dried completely by the lambic and fruit acidity as well as woodiness (also from the cherry stones), therefore lasting very long, even a bit coarse, but very pleasant if you are into this style.  I tasted this fresh some years back and admittedly, the fresh, crisp cherry sourness has decreased a bit, but in this old bottle you get a more noble, rounded and elegant character.  Very interesting to taste at this age - as is always the case in the authentic lambics.  Had this right after a young Oud Beersel Oude Kriek and though style-wise they are basically the same thing, it is not hard to come to the conclusion that beers of this level of complexity have a necessarily very different character.  Ill never get tired of this most complex of all beer styles.

750 ml "champagne" green bottle, as De Oude Cam Exclusief Oude Kriek, bottled January 2009. ABV is 6.5%. At Cardinal Pub & Bar, Stavanger. Beautiful red colour, moderate pink head. Intense and lovely aroma of sour cherries, farmhouse and almonds / marzipan. Relatively light bodied. The flavour is quite sour, but not extreme. Sour cherries of course, not very sweet, with a dry finish.
Bottle @ joes. Ruby to purple colour with a small pinkish head. Smells fruity, sour, cherry, raspberry. Tastes sour, mint, fruity, raspberry, slightly brie cheese, funghus. Medium body, nice carbo.

Bottled. Pours slightly hazy amber with an average off-white head. Aroma of cherries, vinegar and almond notes. Slightly sweet flavor that ends up dry and tart. Medium bodied, watery texture and soft carbonation. An excellent Kriek.
UPDATED: AUG 2, 2014 Bottle @joes. Red pink color and a small white head. Smells and tastes fruity, cherries, red fruit.
Sampled @ RBBSG III. Nice red purple color, average sized pinkish head. Aroma and taste are sweet, red fruits, cherries, slightly sourish. Medium body and carbonation.
750 ml bottle from 2005. Opaque dark ruby red with no head. Wow. Huge funk, cherry pit, earthy, house blanket, dry, sour, lemon, makes you pucker up, incredible.

Bottle at home with friends, courtesy of Scott. 2005 Vintage. Huge thanks for this one man! Pour is slightly hazy pink with a small white head that quickly dissipated. Bright cherry pits, strawberry skins, biscuit, vanilla, light spice, sweet tarts, pie crusts, and biscuit in the aroma. Taste is sour cherry pits, light salt, strawberry, vanilla, biscuit, funk, horseblanket and raspberry skins with a big sour finish. Light body with high carbonation. This bottle has developed beautifully and is an exceptionally tasty fruit lambic.

Pour out of 750 ml, 2005, thanks Scott! Hazy red pour with pink head, aroma brought notes of black cherry, sour berry, raspberry, hints of earth, funk, funky basement, dust, hints of earth, slight yeast, touch of cheese, wow. Taste is a mix of sour cherry, funk, oak, blackberry, nice tart fruit, hints of sour funk, earth, cheesy notes, finishing sour, dry. Wow.

bottle shared by my brah mindabinda, thanks! pours almost cloudy bright red with a small off-white cap, some retention and lacing. tons of fresh cherries, their leaves, fruity and juicy phenolic esters, fair dose of funk, pepper, bitter herbs. bright carbonation, light body, lightly tart, astringent, dry and balanced grassy-herbal-spicy finish. excellent.

Bottle shared by Minderbinder, huge thanks bro! Pours a bright red with a light head that leaves light lacing. Nose is of cherries, plain and square. Taste is nice with a clean cherry flavor and a tartness that is under control (which is not always the case with oude krieks in my experience). Body is light and as I just mentioned acidity level is just perfect. Really nice and drinkable, I want more!

Bottle 750ml. Thx Tommy.
Pours purple/red/pink with very low diminishing pink head. Aroma is of cherries, berries, wild yeast, funk. Taste is of cherries, red fruits, spices, funk, acidity, sourness. Palate: Light-medium body. Soft carbonation. Overall: Awesome. Very drinkable. One of the best kriek Ive had.

damn, this is an awesome kriek!! .. ruby .. medium foam .. . cherry and solid rounding tartness .. . slick mouth feel and a long lively carbonation .. . lamborghini style finish, super beer!! .. . . no, thats a parrot. uhh, from the caribbean...

UPDATED: JUN 12, 2014 Bottle (750 ml). Label say 2009, but that doesnt mean anything because they still use 2009 label for their new bottlings. Deep burgundy with a medium pink head and little lacing. Aroma is wonderful with a nice mix of cherries, leaves from a raspberry plant, moderate funk, herbal notes and mineral notes. Nothing is overpowering. Taste is also perfectly balanced with cherries, leaves, moderate funk, herbal presence, dust, mineral notes and wood. Medium body. Moderate cabonation. Dry finish. This is an amazing Kriek. The balance is perfect and its really tasty. Wow! My best fruited lambic so far.

2009 Bottle in our hotel room post night of the great thirst. Bright red pour, slightly hazy with thin pink head. Aroma is really nice, fruity cherries, balanced funk, really nice aroma, waxy fruits. Taste is tart, not too sour, really nice leafy fruitiness, slightly cheesy, really good dosage of cherry, not too in your face and sweet. Palate is soft, light-med bodied, light mineral carbonation. Really nice.
Bottle. Poured a slightly murky red colour with a pink thin head. Sour aroma with lots of cherries. Flavour similar. Sour palate, sour finish, nicely balanced and tasty.

2009

Bright red color. Not too.much funk, lots of fruit, fresh sweet cherry. Well balanced

Bouteille 75cl année 2009. Belle couleur rouge foncé, peu de mousse, assez bien carbonatée. Nez sur les cerises acidulées, le vinaigre de cidre. En couche, cest semblable au nez avec en plus des notes de bois et de cerises mûres, le tout est très complexe.

Bottle, 2005 vintage, with hella thanks to bull11zeye! Pours hazy red with minimal lacing and little head. Aroma has strong cherry notes, cherry skins and stems, some funk, musty basement and barnyard. Flavor is cherry skins, cherries, funky basement stuff. Light plus tartness, but really drying on the palate. Gets better as you get into it and ends up quite lovely. Medium body, flat carbonation. Nice nice nice.
750ml bottle. 2009 Vintage. Poured a reddish color with a pinkish tinged head. Cherries, some lighter vinegar, berries, and a lighter earthiness.

Sample I sort of ran across courtesy of Masse (non-RB). Thanks man, have been hoping to try this for quite some time. Pours vibrant hazy ruby red with a rather small frothy pinkish white head that leaves some soapy trace on the glass while dissipating. Smell is sour, fruity and funky with crackers, sour cherries, lemon juice, leather, barnyard, hay, dry soil, horseblanket, lemon zest, cherry pits and hints of cherry pie. Taste is sour, fruity and funky with crackers, tons of sour cherries, lemon juice, grapefruit juice, leather, dry soil, hay, barnyard, horseblanket, cherry hard candy, unripe raspberries, red currants and moist wood. Mouthfeel is dry, tart, mouthpuckering and medium bodied. Finish is sour, fruity and funky with crackers, sour cherries, grapefruit juice, lemon zest, hay, leather and barnyard. Very very nice...

Bottle, pours hazy red color with light to medium head and lacing. Aromas and flavor are sour cherry, leather, vinegar, oak, and funk. Body was medium with active carbonation. Good kriek but not in my top 5.

Bottle , 05 vintage . Pours dark red , small pink foam 
Smell is fleshy cherry , swimingpool again . Nice !
Good carbo . Sour , cherry , very intence , but very balanced . 
Dry finish . 
Nice !
Deep red sour cherry beer with great taste of cherry, but gushing very hard (bottle date jan.2009).
Pours pinkish red. Large cherry nose. Cinnamon added in the mouth. Mild tartness. Wow.
UPDATED: MAR 23, 2017 Great example of a gueuze kriek. Intensely sour, with a nice touch of the cherries. Very good.

Corked 0.375l bottle, the 2005 version from trade with BelgBeerGeek. Huge thanks Vincent! This is a really deep dark purple, almost blood orange purple one and it had a small kinda bubbly pinkish head that after a while fades in to a islandy and sidesticking film. My, the nose is just so extremely deep, rich and intense! Filled with dark black cherries, concrete cellar floor, wood, grass and even some traces of vanilla. This is the arch example of how a cherrylambic should smell. In the taste it has this really comfortable cherry sourness that I just love. Its not to extreme on the carbonation, not flat just really soft and it feels thick and near oily in the mouth. So much flavor going on here. Its almost as if the cherries are sweet and all the elements around the cherries are bretted and lemon sour. Cause it is a bit like licking a not to sour lemon this. A soft grassy thing also in between all that lovely tart sourness. World class all the way. Huge thanks Vincent! 04.10.2013
375cl bottle @Kulminator, Antwerpen.Tart, cherries aromas. Quite balanced, smooth, very tart. Really nice and enjoyable.

75CL bottle sampled at Ebenezers Ruby red
Almost no nose
Earthy. Not too sour. Kriek at the finish. But nothing mind blowing. I think its a little too earthy for me.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2014 24.08.2013, 0,75l bottle from 2009 @ home:
Nice cherry colored semifizzy longlasting head. Aroma is very rich, concentrated sour cherries, sorrel, grass, thinner, oak, lemons, berry skin. Taste is very acidic sour, vinegar, concentrated sour cherries, lemons, berry skin, sorrel, soda powder, grass. Very nice, probably the best of them all from De Cam.

Bottled (37,5 cl) at t Antwaerps Bierhuiske, Antwerp, Belgium. CLear ruby, medium pink head. A bit restrained cherry aroma, with notes of burnt rubber and leather. Medium bodied, high carbonation. Dry with medium acidity.
Dark red colour, almost no foam or carbonation. Very fruity aroma of sour cherrys, notes of citrus, vinegar and almond. Dry and bitter aftertaste.

July 5, 2013 - bottle shared by Brett. Reddish pour with limited head. Aroma and taste of sour cherry. Taste had a bit of vinegar that was not a good thing. This was a 2009 bottle while the others were 2012 so that may have had something to do with it.

Bottle split at Craft Clerko, big thanks to Bruce, 26/06/13.
Murky cherry red/crimson with a thin off white head.
Nose is tarte berry fruit, cherry pie, musty notes, dank wood dipped in a cherry mash.
Taste comprises dirty berries, light funk, soured cherry drops, funky tones.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, crisp dryish finish.
Solid fruit lambic, fairly simple but well executed.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle split at CBC Clerkenwell. Thanks to Bruce! The pours deep red with a small head. The nose is super tart cherry. Very earthy and full of personality. Quite vivid. The taste is similarly in your face. More earthy cherry compote. Clean acetic tang on the finish. Mild citrus. Slightly buggy. A pretty simple set of flavors, but everythings dialed-in. Light body, active carbonation. Overall, pretty great. This De Cam didnt even gush all over the place! A real bonus given past De Cam experiences.

Bottle at Delirium Café. 1996 vintage. Hazy deep red liquid with small white head. Aroma of almonds, cherries, apples, lemon, grain and funk. Taste is dry and medium to high sour with notes of lemons, almonds and light funk. Light to medium bodied with low to medium carbonation. Really nice.

UPDATED: DEC 18, 2014 Bottle shared at Clockworks 4K/5K/10K gathering, 2013. Absolute gusher - one of the biggest cork pops Ive ever seen.  Pours a deep, but bright red body with light pinkish white lacing. Aroma is my favorite character usually found in cherry lambics - lots of indoor swimming pool musk and sweet cherry pie. Mouthfeel is lightly tart with great notes of sour cherries, bright funky basement, indoor pool, cherry pie, light raspberry and faint cheese. Awesome lambic!

pink head that disappears quickly, the foam bursts open and disappears at once with no lacing. ruby-red colour with some chunks of fruit. aroma of sour cherry, raspberry, wheat delicious nose of fresh fruit. taste of sour cherry, tart, sour, sweetness striking a great balance followed by a bitter, fruit and sour cherry aftertaste.medium carbonation and body. the only thing keeping me from giving it a perfect score is hoping de cam comes up with something even better. just divine!!  bottle 75 cl / bottle on jan-2009 / best before 7-3-2013

2005 Vintage. 375mL bottle at Kulminator, pours a dark pinkish ruby red. Aroma of cherry purée, a mild sourness, and some dusty funky notes. Flavour brings out very sour cherries, a dusty quality, and a touch of vinegar. At 8 years old, time has certainly intensified the sourness of the cherries. Medium acidity and very sour. Wonderful kriek.

Bottle: Poured a clear deep red color lambic with a generous pink head with good retention and some lacing. Aroma of tart cherries is quite intense with some sour notes and some light funky notes. Taste is also dominated by intense tart cherries notes with some light red vinegar notes and a sour finish with limited acidity. Body is quite full with great carbonation. I really enjoyed the amount of cherries in there with the balanced level of acidity and sourness but I would have enjoyed this even more of the funky barnyard notes of the lambic would have come forward a bit more.
Ruby-purple, clear, pink-tinged head.  Aroma of dry crackerlike malt, tart cherries and wood. Flavor:  grainy malt, tart cherries, wood, light acidity, some strawberrylike fruitiness as well.

UPDATED: FEB 3, 2015 Dusty 2006 bottle in Belgium: Carbonation has been calmed, but it still produced some head and it added a soft creaminess to the texture. Dark with ruby-red highlights. Sweet, enticing nose with hints of sugar-coated oak and vanilla beans. Complex flavors and aromas of rich cherries, pits/oak, almond, soft vinegar, and wine. Completely delicious. 2014 bottle from Belgium: Healthy amount of sourness and tartness with a snappy, grapefruit-like characteristic. Lively carbonation. Great cherry flavors.
Bottle at RBWG. Cherry and funk. Cherry pie. Sweet yet tart on the back end . Amazing lambic.
this beer is okay but unfortunately just dont hit the mark on what i want in a kriek.

Bottle from etre gourmet.

Good kriek i like it although not competing with lou pepe kriek or Schaerbeekse. Still very drinkable.

2006 bottle at DHVL. It pours very deep red, with no head whatsoever. The nose is fresh cherry, chamomile, Savlon, subtle sourness and Parma Violets. The taste is tart, juicy cherry, red grape, moderate acidity, lip-smacking sourness through and through, rich fruitiness, tart lemon and Parma Violets. Good balance and massive flavour. Pretty damn sour and delicious. Easily one of the best oude krieks Ive had!

2005 Vintage - 375 ml. sampled @ Kulminator - hazy raspberry coloured, some white lacing - nose is going towards cherry more than kriek, tart but with a fruit sweet edge, nice sourness underneath - taste is good, going fruitier side rather than the more thinned and sour side, some softer fruits, light cellar, light vinegar, light wood - lovely very light syrup body - De Cam is good - this is good stuff - should revisit this one - wonder if aging upped this one a bit

Bottle 2005. Pours red with a small pink head. Tart aroma of cherry, citrus and root cellar. Taste is sour red berries, cherry and citrus. Low carbonation, high sourness in the end that lingers. Amazing!

Bottled 2005
Ruby red colour, pink head. Aroma of cherry, cherry pips, marsipan, light sour, loads of cherry. Quite sour flavour, balanced acidic. Light vinigar, cherry, fruity acids, youghurt and marsipan. Finish quite sour, unsweetened cherry yoghurt.
Really nice, the cherries held up nicely despite the somewhat older age.
(From 37.5cL bottle @ Kor, Retie, Belgium)

Bottle shared by ygtbsm94. Thanks Brad!

Vintage 2005

A: Dark red hue with a subtle haziness. The color is really beautiful. The beer has a rather small head that quickly fades, leaving a few touches of lacing behind.

S: Huge cherry scents with sour funk. The aroma is distinctly Belgian and wonderful.

T: Surprisingly tart, even though I was expecting it. Cherries are prominent throughout, along with a funky sourness that makes your mouth pucker and eyes squint in lambic delight.

M: The beer is very acetic, but not harsh. Its amazingly tart and enjoyable.

D: Id love to have this one again. I found it extremely pleasant, enjoyable, and intriguing. Its a great beer to savor and inhale the bouquet of sour cherries.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 11-07-2010

UPDATED: JUN 27, 2014 375 mL bottle @ De Heeren van Liedekercke. Pours dark reddish plum appearance with no head. Rich cherry syrup-like, a bit funky, light barnyard, richly tart nose. Very tart, rich berry, cherry, almost cherry skin, mild tannin, a touch woody, incredibly tart flavor. Fun to drink. (3.8)2005 bottle, thanks to doodler. Tons of bright, juicy cherry. Not syrup-like at all. Really funky. Full of cobwebs. My goodness. This is full of black cherries. Sweet oak. Very puckering. Petes pretty fucken good. (4.2)

Pour is transparent dead blood red liquid with no head.  Very dustry and dry, oak notes accompanying the funk with faint sour cherries and a touch of metallic twang.  The taste is much sweeter than the nose, dry funk, faint, almost not there.  The cherries are a bit muted by the sourness and lightly acetic in the finish.  Medium body, soft on the palate with a strong carbaontion and prickly back palate.

2004 Vintage at De Heeren van Liedekercke 

Pours a very deep red with a very small head.

The aroma is lots of sour cherry, some mild bug spray, lots of earthiness and funky barnyardy stuff. Mmmmm.

The flavor is very nice, lots of sour and tart cherry character. Very earthy, somewhat briney, and a little tad bit of vinegar character. Pretty sour cherry focused... as it ought to be.

375 ml bottle from March 2004, so 8 years old. Pours a clear reddish hue but later pours make it hazy. A medium white head. A rich nose of cherries, wood and sourness. A really nice flavor: initially very sour and woody, but as your palate adjusts the cherries become huge, even a hint of vanilla. Woody. Very good, clean and refreshing.
Jättesur och god. Trevlig ekdoft, men frukten är det inte mycket kvar av. Flaskan är från 2005.

A nice, bright pink in colorw with a strong white head.  A great kriek...tart but not aggressive with a clean finish.

Notes:  Tour de Gueuze 11

Bottle.

Clear blood red with a minimal head. Aroma and taste of wood, funk, earth, cherries and lemon. Really tart. Great beer! (my first one from De Cam)

Dark blood red colored pour. No head and no lacing. Very still looking drink. Sour pie cherry aroma. Bit of a fresh cherry aroma. Very dry and tart funky flavor. Some cherries come through on the finish, but during the drink it is very tart and dry. Pretty good.

Bottle: bottle date 2009:
Small pretty vast and slow disappearing reddish pink head on top of a dark purple pink colored beer. Looks delicious, though if the head stayed on for a longer while this beer would have definately gotten a 5 for looks.
Smell cherries, fresh cherries, bit like candy but also with sour hints, some cinnamon and something like brown sugars.
Taste is acidic at first but turns more fuller and not only sour.
Lots of cherries, sour cherries, some hints of older hops (and malts), spices and some sticky sugars that are less present than the sourness.
Light dry warm fruity (cherry) spicy aftertaste. (with the first couple of gulps, the aftertaste seems to disappear quicker than when warming up in the glass).
Low carbo, acidic sour light dry mouthfeel, full body and creamy texture.
Sidenote: When pouring the last bit of beer out of the bottle there seems to come along some dark pink snotty-a-like substance... Strange but the beer seems to taste even better.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text:
Huge, huge thanks to craytonic for sharing a 375mL bottle of this. 2005 vintage served in a Cantillon tumbler.

Pours a really nice red color with a bit of a rust-brown hue to it. It starts out with a short head and doesnt gather much in the way of lacing. The nose is a great mixture of cherry and funk, with some acidity lingering in the background. Nothing too over the top, and the cherries dont completely the over the base beer.

The flavor follows the nose for the most part. The cherry is still fairly muted, but comes out a tad bit more along with accompanying acidity. Nice underlying funk and earthiness. Light body with moderate carbonation for the style. Good acidity through the finish. Acidic, yet smooth. Very well done.

37,5cl bottle. Old label. Pours a murky purple colour with virtually no head, which anyways goes away fast. Aroma of tart cherries, some vinegar and red berries. Flavour is tart upfront. Little sweetness to speak of. Tons of cherries and hay. The nice fruit presence balances quite well the tart lemony presence. Impressive.

Bottle labeled as Kriek Lambiek. Clear ruby red colour without head or carbonisation. Acidic aroma of sour cherries, fungi and moldy yeast. Flavour is thick, acidic and really returns the cherry. Finished the entire bottle because my friends didnt like it. Luckily I gave it a chance and it turned out to be great.

09 vintage. Pours a nice dark red color with no head and looks just like a red wine. Aroma is of dark cherries, almonds, vanilla, currants, tart notes, vinegar, red apple and funk. The flavor follows the nose with some tart and sour flavors with the dark cherries, funk in the way of wet hay and barn yard, an old dusty flavor, vanilla, almonds, vinegar and some currants. The body is light with a dry mouthfeel. Overall a really interesting Kriek Lambic, that reminds me a little of the Danish dish Ris a la Mande.

Bottle thanks to a good trader! Pours a cloudy ruby red with a white head that dissipates nearly completely. Aroma is full of tart cherries with a nice earthiness and a good amount acid. Flavor has nice amount of cherry with a hint of sweetness but mainly tart wit good amount of acid and funk.

375 ml bottle @ Pikkulintu.
Rated on 20110729.
Pours tepid red colour with a minimal head. Aroma has sour cherries, raspberries and redcurrant. The flavour is pretty much the same. The sour palate is nice and tangy and the berries keep on the background. Well balanced brew.
3375
Bottle.From 2002.Hazy red with no head.Aroma of ripped cherrys.acid and almond.Flavor is light sour and bitter with hint of wood and marzipan light dry and nice finish.

UPDATED: SEP 27, 2013 Bottle in Rome during The Stag Do. Dry, lots of cherries. Tart, some sting. Sour. Moderately sweet. Good stuff. (4.1)Bottle shared at a CBC Clerkenwell tasting. Pours deep, cloudy red with a foamy white head. Good sweat and funk in the nose, some jammy fruits. Light sweet flavor with big tang, juicy raspberry and cherry notes. Great balance. Light to medium bodied with fine to average carbonation. Clean and tangy to finish. Great one. (4.2)

Hazy reddish pink pour at Ebs. The nose holds cherry skins and tons of acidic funky notes, with a flavor that will peel the enamel right off the teeth. Farmy hay, funky horse, and acetic acid to the max. Uber dry acidic mouthfeel with a puckering finish. Love it!

Pink red pour at Ebenezers for Night of the Great Thirst.  
Aroma is Cherry flesh, funky horsiness, lots of acid.  lightly carbonated, flavor is very sour upfront and then the fruit comes through in spades, tons of rich cherry fruit, and some sweaty horsey twang on the end.  Finishes dry and acidic.  A delicious Kriek.

2005 Vintage, 750ml, Lions Pride, Brunswick ME.

Extremely sour!  Fruit was a bit restrained, but well balanced with the sourness and funk . The beer is clear and bright, with a fairly high level of carbonation.  Be careful not to get too much of the sediment in the the last glass, this definately changed the mouthfeel and appearance.  This is a beer worth seeking out, and at $65.00+ / bottle it is a decent value for what you are getting.

1999 Vintage.

A: The cork comes out without much of a sound and the beer pours an almost flat, murky, red color.

S: Despite a lackluster appearance, there is a very strong aroma.  Big-time cherries which have a decent amount of sweetness, but still plenty of tartness and lactic acid.  There seems to be a mild oak aroma as well as some grass and straw.

T: The flavor is really quite sour, more so than I expected, in fact.  Lots of cherries, which again give a mild sweetness along with plenty of tartness.  There is some musty funk and a bit of straw and grass.

M: Medium in body with a very low level of carbonation.

O: A fantastic Kriek.  Glad to have finally tried this beer and that it was as good as I had hoped.

375 ml bottle @ Olutravintola Pikkulintu, Helsinki. Bottled 2005.
Pours a unclear yellow colour without a head. Aroma of stinging cherries with floral notes. Flavour of stinging sour cherries, some strawberries and highly stinging oak. Medium bodied with a lovely stinging cherry-driven finish with a mouth-drying sour, fruity finish. Nice one.

2005 vintage 375ml bottle @ Pikkulintu, Helsinki

Pours red with a minimal head. Aroma has notes of cherry, fruits and berries. Taste is quite sour and sweet with notes of cherry, berries and some fruits. Finish is slightly sweet and sticky. Well balanced kriek.

37,5 cl bottle @ Olutravintola Pikkulintu
Beautiful red color with no head. Rather light aroma is sour and has some berry juice. Very sour flavour with some berry juice. Very dry palate. Nice kriek and sour enough.
Clear amber with an off-white head. Aroma is moderate sour - vinegar - and cherries. Flavor is light sweet, rather sour and rather acidic. Bone dry and moderate acidic finish. 090711

06 against an 06 Lindemans Cuvee Rene Kriek. Dark ruby, no head. Nose of hay and dust, light brett in leather, and only the slightest cherry. More cherry in the flavor, strong and musty, light lactic acid sourness brings some soft citrus along the tongue with hints of acetic acid lurking about. Sticky, funky, and well integrated, but the brett in the nose is a bit strong, particularly against De Cams own kriekenlambic and when compared to the more fruity Cuvee Rene Kriek.

375 ml bottle.   notes of moderate to heavy sour lactic acid sourness balanced by some smooth creamy cherry fruit character.    pleasant cheesy, leathery funk.   super dry.  not terribly complex, but super tasty and drinkable.  great beer.

375 ml bottle shared by lushawn- thanks, pal! Pours a hazy reddish plum color with minimal visible carbonation or head. Notes of tart cherries, balsamic, yogurt, oak, earthy funk, and sour grapes. Not as acetic as the Oude Lambiek but still pretty damn sour. Medium-bodied, with moderate carbonation and a tart, fruity mouthfeel. Very much enjoyed this one.

UPDATED: APR 10, 2011 75cl bottle, vintage 2005. When I opened this the smell of cherries and funk was immediate. This is one barnyardy Kriek! The colour is a murky blood red and a decent pour produced a head that didnt stay around for long. The taste is fantastic! There is a serious amount of cherry still in this even after 6 years! It tastes fresher than many krieks with only 2 years of age. There is oak and cherry everywhere and there is a sourness that creeps up on you. This is on the higher scale of sourness but its not a bad thing. This really reminded me of the 3F scharbeekse Kriek which was also 2005 vintage.

37.5 cl bottle, 2005.  Clear crimson with a trace of pinkish froth.  Nose is funky, earthy cherries, wet blanket and toffee.  Medium light with a sparkle.  Taste is cherry and raspberry jam with a touch of lemon zest and funk.  Still showing a lot of fruit after 6 years.
Bottle 0,375ltr: Hazy red coloured pretty sour Lambic with an classic cherry taste. This is the kind of Lambic i really like.

2006 vintage, 375ml bottle received in a past trade with javib458. Thanks a lot Javier!

Pours a dark ruby red, almost plum color with dark cherry/mahogany edges when held to a light source. There was a medium sized pop when I got the cork out but this beer poured completely still with no head to speak of.

Extremely FUNKY aroma with lots of earthy, stinky barnyard character. Lots of bugs and horseblanket with oak tannis and a boat load of sweet cherry. Im surprised how well the cherry has held up in the nose. Kind of smells like 3F Schaerbeekse Kriek but much more musty and funky. Hints of cheese, feat and bandaid but in a good way.

Extremely sour and mouth puckering with a lot of earthy, musty funk and oaky tannis which is countered by a sweet tart cherry presence. Wow, this beer has become crazy funky and sour with a lingering puckering, vinegary finish that leaves me drooling for more. Although this beer is very acidic and not easy to drink, the aftertaste is incredible and I want another sip immediately. As in the aroma, the cherry fruit flavor has held up incredibly well. I know that this beer uses real cherres but the flavor is so prominent it tastes like cherry juice is added. Lots of tart sweetness balancing out the musty funk and earthy oak. After the initial palate shock this beer becomes less intense and stomach burning but its still a sipper.

This beer is delicious and incredibly complex and Im glad that I finally got a chance to try it. I wish De Cam beers were available here because I would buy this regularly. Now I need to find the Oude Gueuze!

375 ml bottle, 2006 vintage, from Ohtsuki. Rather faint aroma of cherries, yogurt, earth, some leather. Almost subtle, but nice. Rather light red, well, lighter than others, just a small head that quickly disappeared. Strong sourness at first sip, lemon, lactic acid, cherry, leather. Sourness really takes over, making it more one-dimensional than expected. good, but not great. Cherry flavor is a bit worn, though still good lambic.

Bottle at Where the Wild Beers Are with much thanks to Max and Jess. Burnt sienna pour. Aroma is a good mix of sharp acetone with soft raspberries and a touch of black cherry. Flavor is sharp and tart of sour cherry and lemon. A moderate level of barnyard too. Awesome mouthfeel. A great stickiness thats soft yet tingly. Theres a really great mix of aggressive and soft features. Im a big fan.

UPDATED: JUL 28, 2013 2005 vintage (750ml) opened November 2010.
A: As it pours out of the bottle its got a medium, yet clear red color, but as the glasses were filled it turned a darker blood red with some haze to it. One finger, pink bubbly head that crashed immediately. Spotty lacing.
S: Tons of cherries. An undercurrent of slight sweetness, but predominately a bold tartness with hints of oak.
T: Wonderful sour and tart cherries. Like the de cam gueuze, this has a really clean profile that isnt particularly funky or musty. It is wonderfully delicious, though. Just a few hints of sweetness and oak, but mostly blasts of sour cherries.
M: Smooth, perhaps slightly undercarbonated for a kriek. Definitely not still though. Quite acidic and sour, but not caustic.
O: Top notch. De Cam really knows what they are doing. I just wish I didnt have to order these from Belgium.

Bottle from 2006 which Im pretty sure Max and Jess brought to the Where the Wild Beers Are event graciously hosted by Mission Dolores.  Pours a lightly hazed pink brown with a thin white head.  Cherry and funk, light acid.  A bit of acetone and vinegar.  Light sweetness, big tart acid.  Long lingering acid, very nice finish.

Bottle from 2005 at Moeder Lambic in Brussels, it had tons of dust on it! The aroma is sweet and fruity at first, and then a bit wild and sharp like in the Schaersbeek from 3 Fonteinen. The awesome appearance is a big foamy head on top of a gorgeous deep ruby red color. The flavor has tartness throughout the entire sip, but it is smooth on the palate overall. You get notes of barley and cherries as well.

Bottle at Delirium in Brussels. Unimpressive label, as my girlfriend noted. Pours a deep, hazy ruby with orange tints and minimal head. Aroma holds ltos of wood, dank funk, and great fruitiness- black cherry and tart raspberry- two of the best fruits in lambic. Flavor starts with the dark cherry and some vanilla notes, then the tartness builds noticeably to an extreme puckering finish. Not your typical dry tartness, but a lingering, bold presence. Very very nice.

head: nothing 
colour: deep watermelon red 
smell: very acidic , lambic, malts, light undernote of sweets and black cherries 
taste: very very sour start, malts in the beginning , red wine/ port wine, and only a bit of cherrys in the end, texture is oily , finish is dry

6th March 2010. Cloudy strawberry coloured beer. Dry palate. Sharp lemony sourness, burns on the way down. Too sour for me. A Girardin Black Label I can understand and enjoy - this is just lemon juice to me!

Radical aroma:  sweaty saddle, chili pepper, cherry, with a little hint of jock strap/BO (but in a strangely satisfying way).  Medium plus acidity with a lot of tart cherry flavor and lighter funk than the aroma would suggest.

Big thanks to my bro for picking these up for me. 750ml bottle dated 2005  Poured into my vintage Duvel tulip. A nice, reddish pink body with a creamy white head. Aroma is pure funk, with cherry aromas. Crazy tart, with a serious tart mouthfeel and sour fruit flavors. Just a hint of cherries lingering in the background. Finishes dry and oh so sour. And did I mention tart?  Pucker up buttercup...tasty. A must try for kriek lovers everywhere....

Bottle at DC Epic tasting thanks to Travlr.  Poured a murky bright red with a thin fizzling pink head.  Tart cherry pie nose.  Puckering palate with cherry, pepper notes.  nice sour body.  Taste was better than the aroma lead on.  Great brew

Sampled at DC Epic Sour Tasting 2010.  Pours a basically opaque, cherry red with a thin, creamy, lightly pink head.  Nose is really musty, berries, cherry pie, dusty, spices, hay.  This reminded me of the brettanomyces lambicus strain Id used in some home brew.  Flavor is tart, cherry, berry, malty, peppery, celery.  Finish is medium bodied, tart and lightly acidic.

750mL courtesy of Travlr. Pours a cloudy, beautiful pink with a large light pink, bubbly head. Aroma is straight up cherry pie. Taste is rich baked cherries, cherry pie. The sourness is relaxed, well integrated. No stupid sweetness or syrupy qualities. No medicinal qualities. This is just kriek done correctly.

750mL bottle from 2005.  Pours a deep, cloudy pinkish red with a bit of pink head.  Aroma has tart cherries, maybe a touch of dusty basement.  Taste has lots of sour cherries, medium acidity, some musty straw.  Finish has some cherry and lemon peel.
2005, drank in June 2010. Nice cherry nose, just a bit medicinal, lots of lactic acids. Taste is lightly sweet, moderately sour, lots of cherry, funky cheese, cobwebs and dusty yeast. Excellent.

Pours a dark red but clear color with almost no head.  Aroma of very strong tart cherries and raspberries, oak wood.  Flavors of very sour fruits,tart cherries and raspberries, old aok wood, spices, liquore and hints of lemons.  Almost no carbonation, very tart sour fruity and dry finish.  Theres a lemon acid present and more cherries fisnih. You can taste the lambic passion in here, wonderfull.

Bottled sample (dated 09/2004) from De WIldeman. Dark pink in colour with spritzy carbonation. Aromas are of lemon peel, cherry pits, funk, and spicy wood. The lemon elements become quite acidic in the mouth, but combine with notes of cherry blossom, barnyard and dry old wood into something quite magical. Very dry. The cherry is more floral than fruity, which seems to be a bit unique in my experience.
bottle thanks to bierkoning.  poured cherry red.  aroma was tart and raspberry.  flavor was raspberry and cherry with a light and dry body.  nice drink.....thanks edo!!

(375ml bottle best by 1-10-06 so this is 14 years old! thanks ericandersnavy) opaque ruby red thats completely still, but good legs. Nose of ripe cherries, funk, wet/old wood, lightly sour. Great nose. Taste of very tart cherry skins, pits and all. Long sour duration, light body. Vinegary finish.
bottle, thanks to ericandersnavy, pours  a raspberry koolaid color  with no head, aroma of cherry, sour raspberry, cucumber,  taste is sour cherry , pie crust, plums and port wine

Bottle with a best before date of Jun 10, 2006 (so a 1996?) thanks to ericandersnavy. Pours with a red wine colored body with no head. Aroma of horseblanket, really, really dry, hint of cherry, tannins and vanilla. Taste is sour, cherry pie, tart, wood, biting acidity. Light bubbles. Really pretty awesome!
Crystal clear ruby red beer with a cherry and wood aroma. Light bitter, dry and sour taste. Very nice mild cherry taste. Dry tart finish. A very good kriek.

bottle shared by beejay at the chicago sour tasting. 2006 vintage... dark red berry pour with an almost non-existent head...  odd aroms of a blown out firework, some smoke, and red fruits... flavors again had that aspect of a lit firework, tart sour cherries without a lot of acidity.  low to medium carbonation.  that smoke quality really threw me off.

Bottle. Opened with a big pop! Pours slightly hazy reddish copper coloured with a bubbly pinkish white head. Very fizzy/noisy brew with lots of bubbles. Dusty aroma with notes of caramel, marzipan, wood, stinging spiciness, berry fruit, balsamic vinegar and of course cherries. Awesome! Sour and dry flavour with spicy and fruity notes. Great beer.

Bottle. 2004 vintage. 

Nice red color with orange hues and a big pinkish head that fizzes away rather fast. 

The aroma really pops out of the glas as the beer releases a lot of carbonation quickly. The aroma is funky and slightly acidic with muted notes of cherries, bitter grass, vinegar and mud.

The flavor is acidic and surprisingly bitter with a mild complementary cherry sweetness. Even though the bitterness is very prominent, it is only relatively so. Its still sour flavors that star in this show. Muted notes of genuine cherries, lots of grass and hints of mud and vinegar. The aromas have a hard time getting through the strong acidic and bitter flavors. The finish gets a bit unbalanced as the bitterness doesnt really integrate with the sourness. It ends very dry with nice cherry notes. 

Moderate body and very effervescent at first due to plenty of carbonation. 

A good one. Balanced despite the bitterness. A genuine old-fashioned kriek.

Bottle from Dranken Geers. 37.5 cl from jan. 2006. The cork goes up with a bang. Nice. Deep dark red - almost brownish pour with a pink fizzy head. Seems to be rather high carbonated. the nose is besides the krieks also has a strawberry sweetness and wooden notes and vinegar. The taste is straight forward kriekish with a massive bitterness but with a watery an anonymous finish

37,5cl 2006 bottle at De Demervallei. Beer is red and very cloudy with a very small head that disappears after some time. Aroma is full of cherrys and a deep sourness. What a beatifull smell. Taste is sweet with a lot of cherrys and a nice dry musty sourness. Both the sweet cherrys and the dry sourness stays for a very long time. Mouthfeel is good with very few carbonization, but the everlasting dryness makes everything good. The label says: "niet zoet" what means "not sweet" and that is exactly what you taste.

Thank you, Peter, for this exceptional sour.  This was a very well-aged version.  Clear, bright ruby red with a loose, light pink head.  Wonderful cherry aromas, both fresh and fermented, with excellent aged characteristics.  Full and multi-faceted with a lot of dimension.  The flavor is incredibly sour with a purity that is pure genius.  It captures the entire spectrum of cherry flavors--sweet, tart, bitter, fresh, aged, fermented, oxidized, tannic--and fuses it with a clear malt base that delivers the flavors skillfully.  This leads directly into a superbly balanced body that is very refreshing and vibrant.

Courtesy of dasilky by way of gabf hotel sleepers. Pours a tussin color with no head and just a ring of bubbles around the outer rim. Smell makes my tongue recoil and water. Super sour cherry on the nose, strawberries, and a nice barnyard funk presence. Taste is super sour, makes my eyes water and my tongue dance..POW! Right in the kisser. Cherries, brett, hay, and sour...just pure awesome sour power...POW! The consistency is that of water...with a kick...its low alcohol but I can feel some burn...that may just be the heart burn though...POW!

Traded MJ a hotel bottle of shampoo for this - 2006 Vintage (the beer, not the shampoo): Pours a flat red with blood-orange tendencies. Cherry bandage nose, tart but not overwhelming...I was actually expecting to be disappointed because of the flatness of the appearance and mellowness of the nose..but damn, flavors punch you in the face with a heat seaking tartness missle. Theres subtle funkiness riding behind to keep it interesting but not too interesting, and an oily slick, absolutely amazing mouthfeel that this may be one of the very few beers where I dont mind the non-existent carbonation. The cherry is more an essence than a tangible flavor because of the total lack of sweetness here but regardless, you dont ever forget your drinking a kriek. a powerhouse of a kriek that is unrelenting in its ...uh..power.

Bottled from 2004.Pours almost clear red with a fast diminishing small pink head. Lively carbonation. Aroma of  sour cherries. Taste is big sour with hints of berries. Sour strawberries. Tearing my mouth up. Its smooth and fresh. Finishes sour and bitter. Very good kriek

RBSG 07. Bottle from 2005. Lean, sour, funky, very dry. Cherry presence is strong without being sweet- tart and mildly bitter with a bit of juice. Medium body, balanced. From notes. Ive had this beer a few times since and this easily my favorite kriek Ive ever had. Awesome.

Bottle from January 2006 sample #9 from 1st CST.  Pours a murky dark wine-red with basically no head.  Aroma is full of sulfur, but still quite pleasant, dusty funky moldy cheesy tart cherries, some formaldehyde.  Flavor of cherry pool water, tart aged cherries, moldy/cheesy, not terribly tart overall though, just sour enough.  Medium bodied with flat carbonation.  I know this is a great beer from my samplings in Belgium.

Dark ruby red, probably the reddest ive ever seen! Aroma is full of cherries, so full that it borderlines artificial which I have a bit of a problem with. Flavour is similar but with more mature, acidic and woody cherries. Very drinkable and absolutely packed with cherries.

Jan 06 bottle, from the First Annual Chicago Sour Tasting. Hazy red pour with no head, pretty much flat. Aroma is strangely dominated by a sulfury fireworks aroma, which I havent gotten from this beer previously. Sour cherries linger in the background, but are overwhelmed by the sulphur aroma. Flavor reveals a nice tart cherry flavor, but still has that sulphur note detected in the aroma. It isnt wholly unpleasant, but its kind of dissapointing. Nice lingering tartness is pleasant.
Bottled. Pours a murky red. Smells of gooseberries. Sour with aromas of berries. Tart. Hint of toothpaste. Sour strawberries.

Jan 06 bottle from the First Annual Sour Tasting, thanks to Beejay.  Odd nose.  Sulfur like someone lit off a pack of bottle rockets. with raspberries. Murky red purple color with no head.  Fruit raspberry flavors that are dirty with that gunpowder.  Tart lightly sweet flavors that werent that great.

33cl bottle at Moeder Lambic. Pours deep red like Welch grape juice ! Medium head, not very long retention. Nose is very fruity, moderately tart and lightly acidic. Taste is very fruity. Lovely fruity tartness. Low acidity. Tartness is perfectly balanced for my taste. Best kriek to date. Awesome beer. Will have again for sure. Re-rate the next day. I had another bottle that was not as good. It was more tart and less fruity. It had no head at all. Slight off flavour, maybe it was not top shape. Rating stays the same.

Bottle at t Brugs Beertje in Brugge.  Slightly hazy deep red color with a nice pinkish head.  Aroma of sour cherries, and vinegar.  Flavor is strong sour cherry, wood, and a little funk.  Very sour, even a little more so than I would consider ideal.  Palate dry and biting with fairly high carbonation.  Sourness lasts in your mouth for awhile.

375 ml bottle, via bu11zeye.  Pours a beautiful pink red body with a wispy pink head that ran to a thin ring.  A great sour note of vinegarette on the nose, nice woody and pitty notes, great sour cherry.  The flavor is nicely tart and sour, bone dry, very pitty and woody, with some excellent lambic funk, slightly cheesy.  Mouthfeel is bone dry with great fine lively carbonation.  Long lingering vinegary finish.  Not quite as sour as many Cantillons, but clearly among the best Krieks that Ive had.  I wish that this were available in the US!

Bottle at  t Brugs Beertje. Hazy red/burgandy color with a nice off-white head. Aroma of nicely sour cherry. Medium body with smooth carbonation. Flavor is sour cooking cherry. It stays that way through the fiish. This is the test for kriek. Its tearing my mouth up. Its smooth and fresh. Finishes sour and bitter. Bet this helps dentists cash flow.

(Bottle - bottled 2005 - at Pikkulintu, Helsinki, on 2009-07-09) Red like cherry juice and hazy. Small white head. Sherry stones, sherry and sourness in aroma. Medium bodied, mouth-watering and very dry palate with quite low carbonation. Cherry, cherry stones, sourness, light bitterness, grains and  berries in taste. Berries and sourness in aftertaste.

2002 bottle @ Akkurat.  Pours red with bright pink head.  Aroma is overwhelmingly funky sour cherries.  Taste follows with huge sourness, acetic acid, and cherries.  Prickly on the palate and the sourness lingers nicely in the finish.  De Cam = good.

Bottle. Vintage 2002. Hazy dark red body with a small reddish head. Lots of sour and spicy cherries in aroma with some woody notes. Slight citric notes as well. Lovely sweet cherry flavour with a pleasant bitter sour acidic touch. Very well balanced. Low carbonated body that siuts this lambic perfect.

Bottle vintage 2002, at Plan B.
Pours an hazy red colour with a reddish head.
It has a pleasant dry aroma with sour cherries, wood and some sweet hints.
Flavour is low carbonated and very sour at first, followed by a sour cherries and woody taste, all ending in a nice and slightly sweet woody-cherry aftertaste.

2005 bottle. Pours a clear cranberry red color with a thin white head. The aroma is awesome and quite powerfull, theres a good dose of cherries with dust, acidity and pleasant belgian funk. The cherries are less powerfull in the aroma, but its quite acid and dusty, lean, low carbonated body is just right to the funk going in the mouth. This is really excellent, on of the top krieks out there.

Bottle.  Red wine in appearance with hints of purple.  Aromas are dark sour cherries with woody and earthy notes.  Flavours are very tart and acidic citrus.  Dry and refreshing with some sweet cherry coming through on the finish.  Further addictive sourness on the aftertaste.
Bottle.  Vibrant red beer with a lightly sour aroma and flavour.  Overall a nice sour beer.

UPDATED: MAR 26, 2009 (37,5 cl bottle from Pelgrims) Very dark red kriek with a very small, almost unexisting head. Taste is very pure and sour, but with hints of sweetness.

Theres no carbonation, which makes it taste like a fruit-juice/lemonade.
37,5 bottle. Nice sourness with sweet cherry finish. Palate is not very outspoken and aroma is rather limited for a Kriek.
GodofThunder brought this.  Very red....veryveryvery red.  SMells very  strong cherry and musty.  Makes your face scrunch up when you drink it.  HIts you in the back of the tongue.

Thanks to my friend Troy who brought this back from Belgium for me.  Pours a cloudy red color with a very dusty, funky and cherry aroma.  Flavor is super-sour with more funk and cherries.  This is exceptionally sour and an exceptional beer.

UPDATED: JUL 20, 2009 375ml bottle from Drankencentrale, Rutsaert.  Slightly mirky blood red color with slight white head, but not much.  Aroma is sweet and cherry with subtle sour and earthiness.  Flavor is sweet and sour cherry with earthiness, tart, dirty, some vinegar, not bad.  Medium body with no carbonation but big tart pucker.  Not bad, but a little off mark.  8 3 8 3 16 = 3.8

Rerate during the First Annual Chicago Sour Tasting thanks to Beejay.  Vintage Jan06.   Dark red with small, almost non-existent head.  Aroma is funky, a little sweat socks, sulphury, cherry.  Cherry, tart flavor with red winey, oak, sulphur, tannins.  Meidum body with slight pucker, good carbonation.  Really weird, not how I remember this beer. 3 5 6 3 11 = 2.8

Sample courtesy GodofThunder. Pours a brownish red with little carbonation. Sour vinegar, old shoes, sour cherry aroma. Really sour tart vinegar cherry taste. Just rip your fave off sour and an intense experience.
dark red coloured body with a small pink head a sourig fruity aroma a sourig fruity ( cherry) taste with a sourig cherry bitter finish

Darker red coloured beer with some very light carbonation and a small pinkish head. Sour fruity cherry aroma. Full sour fruity palate. Finish is again fruity, cherry, sour with some light peppery touches. Nice one.
Red coloured beer with almost no head. A sour fruity aroma. Full bit sour palte. Finish is very sour. I’ve drunk better, but good one.

Bottle shared at the Carolina Crew tasting by OldStyleCubFan - thanks, Todd! 05 bottle was a real treat, one of the highlights of a mighty tasting. Vibrant reddish pour with a fairly still body. The nose was intensely woody, even as the fruit came through strongly. A promising harbinger of an excellent beer, deeply tart with a big body and an emphatic woody finish. Really great.
’05 bottle shared by Todd.  Bright red-orange pour with no head. Tart cherry and yummy barnyard funk.  Sour and delicious.
Thanks to Todd for this!  Hazy red pour and a fizzy red head.  Tart barnyard aroma.  Abundant sour cherry flavor and a nice woody dry finish.

A warm up before a rare and aged scotch tasting.  This was fantastic.  Like John, the vinous character was reminiscent of both Blaebier and St. Lamvinus.  Spectacular cherry in both the aroma and flavor but with a better than average tartness.

Courtesy of BDR.  An exceptional, fruit filled lambic.  It is very thick on the palate, and has a vinous, unfiltered fruit juice quality to it that reminds me of Cantillon Blaebier or St. Lamvinus.
