Abundant cherry in the aroma and the flavor.  Not as sour as some, but it is no Lindemans.  A first rate fruit lambic.
Ruby red with giant white head.  Nice fruity aroma.  Full mouth, great sourness with acidic musty finish.  Top of the style.

Pours a rich hazy red raspberry color with a small white head. The nose is tart, barnyard funk, musty, cherry, vinegar and touch of wood. Initial taste begins with a touch of cherry, sour funk pours over the mouth giving you a nice pucker. Mid palate displays some musty, earthiness that is very nice. Finishing dry with a continuing sour, hints of cherry, light wood and vinegar. Body is very light but pleasing and refreshing for this beer. Palate duration is above average. Minor head retention. Probably the most refreshing lambic I have ever had. A expensive one indeed and well enjoyed.
rossa schiuma non abbondante poco peristente note fruttate ciliegia mandaorla amara leggera meffa in bocca acidità media finale ciligie non estrma ma buona

What an awesome kriek. A deep and muddy red in color, no head. Aroma is cherry, of course, but with underlying earthiness of peat and funk. Really robust and flavor that grows more complex after the initial taste of black cherries. Just a wonderful drink.

Pours murky red, no head, slight carbonation.  Aroma of cherry sourness, mustiness, funky earthiness. Flavor is musty cherriness.. absolutely beautiful.  Smooth, slightly dry finish... excellent kriek.  Alas it was my only one.
bottle thanks to bhops.  red pour with no head at all.  sour, funky cherries with earthy musky notes.  very smooth on the palate with great sour notes and a very tart finish.

Bottle 37,5 cl. Small rocky off-white lasting head. Hazy light cloudy dark red body. Nice aroma of cherry and cask wood, vinegar. Medium body and lively carbonation. The flavor is heavy acidic and light bitter. A dry fruity beer.
Bottle, thanks to brad in a trade.  Pours a rad hazy body.  Yeasty tart woody cherry funk.  Very sour and lemon and light acidity.  Amazing!
38cl, from De Hopduvel Gent, complex, balanced, cloudy, nearly no head, good sour Kriek, the best of the De Cam range

The color was ery bright pink/red.  There was minimal head.  The aroma was very tart, chlorine, and light razberry/cherry.  Theflavor was extremely sour, ruit, and razberry/cherry.  The palate was thin with no carbonation.  The finish was sour.
My 1800th rating. Vintage bottle @ Plan-B, Copenhagen. Pours muddy & bloody pink with no head or lacings. Tart, cherries, fruity, sticky. Good bite. Sour, dry & refreshing! Funky fresh!!!!!!!
Bottle with a beautiful cheesy aroma. Tough to add a rating for this without mentioning barnyard but I’ll try. Plenty of the fresh cherry leaves your whole chest puckering.

From a 375mL Bottle.  Pours a transparent, blood red color with a thin head of fizzy pink.  A beautiful dark cherry aroma eminates from the glass, skins, pits, and all.  Complex sour notes compliment the fruit beautifully.  Dry leather, lemon rind, mild cheesiness - its all there.  Vibrant fruits and dusty acidity.  Light bodied, softly carbonated mouthfeel with a tickling acidity.  Flavors of tart cherry skins and bold lactic acidity.  Superb cherry flavors without the sweetness.  Moderately sour, with a long, lingering, gueuze-like finish.  Wonderful combination of delicious fruit flavors and gueuze-like sour complexities.  Thanks for sharing, Chris
2006 bottle. Unclear light red with no head. Cherry aroma with a light funk and some almond. Very tart and dry with some cherry acidity, but it could do with a little more funk complexity.

just the stuff to kickoff your platform patent heels and enjoy a night alone on a very comfy empty couch.... blood red in colour and devinely blessed with a gorgeous sour cherry nose this deserves the big cristal burgundy glass its in. how much it reminds me how sour life can be this is a sweet one.
A typical kriek. Light red color. Mild fruitiness in the nose. Soft sourness. Nice cherry aromas.

(Bottle, brewed in 2002, Akkurat, Stockholm, 23 May 2008) Deep red colour, with huge but brief, white head. Slightly cloudy. Tart nose with cherries, almonds, stable, horse blanket, barnyard, old socks and earthy cellar notes. Lovely! Tart taste with notes of cherries, almonds and a long, harsh, sour finish. Lots of carbonation makes it quite lively. This is addictive stuff. Absolutely brilliant.

375ml bottle Pikkulintu, Helsinki, Bitter and Sour 2008. Shared with FatPhil &JK54B 
150508.
Color:nice bit hazy cherry red
Scent:nice sour cherry
Taste: astringent sour delicious cherry. My old favorite first time tasted at One pint years ago. This is piece of art. Genuine lambic

375ml bottle (Pikkulintu, Helsinki, Bitter and Sour 2008)
Deep orangy red, no head. Gentle sour aroma, with some wooden barrel esters. Very sharp sour taste - puckers the mouth and sends shivers down the spine. The cherry is quite subtle in the taste and comes over more as a hint of almond. The wood esters are prominent. The whole combination is superb. Finish is both sour and sweet, fruity in part, and mellows beautifully over several minutes.

375ml corked bottle bought from the store at Oud Arsenaal in Antwerp.  Lively, but not a gusher.  Cherry red color.  Wonderful cherry wheat farmhouse smell.  Delightful lemony tartness, with a hint of cherry in there as well.  Those looking for authentic, sour lambics wont do much better than this one.  Intensely sour.  A masterpiece.

2005 Bottle at the Hotel Centrum, Beersel 25/4/08.  Opened with an audible fizzing. Very deep, opaque cherry colour with no head yet plenty of carbonation. Big cherry fruit aroma with some barnyard depth and vague nuttiness. Tart fruit flavours, with huge amounts of fruit and a long, dry finish. Wonderfully balanced between fruit and lambic.
nice cherry nose....dark red color and not a lot of carbonation.....a little sweet for me...but nice oak flavor kinda balances it out.....

3-29-08 bottle thanks to the amazing Miketd!! 

Ruby red pour with no head.  Smells of cherries and sour candy and funky garbage a little.  Super tart and not super fruity (a huge plus for me).  Nice tart flavor of bright cherries and oak.  Mouthfeel is hint reminiscent of cotton swabs and cough syrup.  Overall, a great beer that I am so glad I got to try.  Thanks Mikey!
De Cam has a strong reputation of shoam, (=mousse in French), something like a fountain that explodes. The "Kriek" delivers the basic substance of geuze with a strawberry, appels taste.

Courtesy of Hopscotch. Pours a murky reddish color with a thin off white head. Aroma is mostly fruit. Tastes of sour fruit, yeast, and little spice. Palate is tart with a smooth well balanced finish. Thanks Eric.

Bottle, Merritt island Throwdown! Absolute ruby red color of crushed raspberries. Sour farmhouse funk aromas. Lively yet satiny palate. Clean, bone dry, tart, no insipid artificial flavor, hardly any sweetness, not complex, not much cherry, all about the lambic. Excellent.

Courtesy hopscotch.  Pours a cloudy, deep, blood red color with a small, fizzy, pinkish head.  Spotty lacing noted.  The nose shows tart cherries, sweet tarts, and mildly funky barnyard yeast notes.  The flavor follows suit, with mouth puckering sour cherries dominating, and various other acidic, indiscernible fruits in the background.  There might be some raspberry in there, as Im getting alot os red juice.  Theres a good deal of barnyard funk to this one.  Very sharp and ascorbic.  Medium bodied, finishing nearly bone dry and sour.  Well balanced.  This one isnt overly complex, but it is masterfully blended and incredibly drinkable despite its intensity.  Awesome beer.

UPDATED: OCT 11, 2009 Bottle 37,5 cl. Pours a shiny red with a white head that immediately fades with some noise. The aroma has hay, barnyard and some fruits. The flavor starts fruity (cherries of course) and very slightly sweet and then becomes sour. A very nice kriek!

(2/26/08) Bottle at Delirium Cafe in Brussels. Deep cloudy red with a pink white head. Acidic aroma of cherries and some barnyard. Sour flavor, very fruity, with some cherries and some sweetish tones. Medium-bodied. Very decent.

Bottle @ Den Tatoverede Enke, Cph.
Pours a very deep red - almost bordering on brown. Looks like a thick fruit juice, actually. A nice, small pink head on top that quickly dissipates. Aroma is initially funky, some barnyard and a light, subdued fruity sweetness. As the beer heats up, though, the cherries really come into play. Some light oakiness as well. Quite lively and highly carbonated - super, creamy mouthfeel. Flavour consists of a truly magnificent blend. Lots of tartness, funkiness and a light fruity sweetness. the funkiness starts it of nicely, then the fruit takes over, lending a more subtle hand to the preecedings. Tart cherry finish. Light vanilla, oak, caramel and funkiness settles this one off nicely. Stunningly balanced!

Big, big thanks to miketd for this hard to get beer!

Pours a deep, thick pomegranate juice color.  Smell is big delicious tart cherries and lots of woodiness to it, and is super smooth, rounded and inviting.  Taste is sour, sour, sour!  Very nice, tart, dry cherry flavor and oaky, vinous, tanniny, drying deliciousness.  No harsh or vinegar like qualities to it, but yet still intensely sour and extremely enjoyable and easy to sip.  Great intense, yet balanced flavor, and I could have easily had more of this. Thanks so much again for this treat, Mike!

Much wanted bottle from miketd on 12/19/07.  Thanks!  Pours lambic flat.  Wonderful cloudy orange red color. Very sour and very tart.  Very dry.  Very good, but needs some food accompanyment. Im not sure what.

375ml bottle brought by wetherel to the PP bottle Shop @ Carlsbad shared with bikesnandbeer and deftim13.  Pours pinkish red with no head.  Nose is big and sweet and full of tart cherry.  Taste is sweet cherry and super tart.  very very very very tart, a damn good tart kriek.
Deep red beer with almost no head. Sourish cherry aroma and flavors. Very refreshing. Some woody and vineous notes.

Bottle shared by MikeTD. Murky red pour. Aroma ofr vinous fruits, oak, funk, tart cherry, pale malt and sour notes. Flavors of tart cherry, oak, vinous notes, and sour. Light body, sour/tart with a sour/dry finish.

thanks to cquiroga for this one.
dark red color, nice tart cherry flavor with some funk and other complexities.

Reddish colour with a small pinkish head. Aroma is a blend of sweet and tart fruity notes with hints of yeast and wood. Sweet fruity flavor with yeasty notes. Dry, dusty and tart finish.
Very good lambic, 2007 bottle 375 ml. Very deep red, acidic and very sour beer in a class of its own, drunk the week of feb. 18th

Aroma:  cherry pits, stems, skins, and dark fruit, some minerals/earthiness, some nectar

Appearance:  dark purple, small white head

Flavor:  sweet n sour cherries, pits, skins, fruit/juice, tartness, with some cream and some sugar--kind of like pie filling

UPDATED: AUG 20, 2014 375ml bottle. 2005 bottling date.  Deep rich purple haze colored body.  Satisfying perfumy plum and potpourri nose, with a musky, sweaty perfumed cherry scent.  Flavor: brash, rich, varying, exciting and wonderous.  Rich, slightly sweet, but very properly sour and tart.  Wonderful performance on the palate, lasting well beyond the end of the drink.  Side by side with Red Poppy and the De Cam is destroying it.


Jan 2006 bottle consumed in March 2009: little to no head formation but enough carbonation.  Nose is intensely pitty and tannic, nutty and woody.  Amazing level of tannic, dry cherry skins, reminds me of rough syrah and sour cherry pits.  Amazing beer, one of the best krieks in existence.

Thanks to turdferguson for sharing this one and thanks to miketd for hooking him up with it. Vintage 2005. Pours a thick bright pink/red. No head. The aroma was very sour and acidic with some background kriek and spice. The flavor is also very acidic and tart, kriek is there but definitely not as the main flavor profile. The palate was tart and acidic.

Bottle from  a trade with Miketd.  Shared with Ethan and Aubrey.  This really hit the spot.  I think I say this every time I have a funky, sour, mouthpuckering beer, but damnit, it does (hit spots).  Nose and flavor are very sour, lots of barnyard, some  oak, and a minimal cherry notes. Sourness is lacking in complexity and malt development a little bit, but I cant complain too much cause I love it.  Could use a bit more acidity in the mouthfeel, but overall very nice.  Thanks again, Mike!

6.5%, botteldatum 03/2004. Claret beer with a hissing pink head collapsing in seconds. A tickle of carbonation. Aroma sherbety Brie rind, stemmy wood, green olive, vinegar dankness and creaking old barrel. Sweetish but tangily balsamic. Whole fruit, blueberry, olives, maybe even cherry. A strange undercurrent of smokiness hinting at antiseptic (TCP?) in the aftertaste and the aroma. Weird, but..harmonious. Prickling with lambic character, but not too punishing on the PH front. Pretty ravishing Kriek
At Akkurat: clear red, little short lasting head, notes off berries and leather (lambik). sour flavour and little watery. An unpleasant metaalic finnish

Bottle Shared with Mr. Facto.  09/2004 vintage.  The beer pours to a deep strawberry red body with a tall pink head thats frothy.  The aroma is strawberries and sour cherries with funky barnyards.  The flavors are balanced funky tart barnyard and wild cherries.  Sweet, nice malts, sour, and delicious.  The palate is sour, funky, tart, and not overly done.  Refreshing and sweet.  Very nice.  I would love to see this in the U.S.

375ml January 2006 Bottle Date; Sampled January 2008
Very minimal carbonation, though more than the Gueuze I just had, the head barely forms a few, extremely small groupings of bubbles after a careful pour.  When roused it forms a pinkish tinged tan colored thin layer of froth that quickly becomes a few lonely islands and a ring of foam.  The beer pours with hazy, cranberry red color that shows a pinkish hue to the red when held up to the light.  The aroma is quite tart as that is what I notice as I am inspecting the beer visually.  A deeper smell of the aroma yields an up front, sharp, tartness (predominantly lactic), followed by a fruity, bright cherry skin aroma.  Sour lemon notes intermingle with cherry aromatics, lightly funky barnyard notes and a touch of urea.  The more time one spends smelling the aroma the more a sour cherry note comes to the fore.  The aroma is not all that aggressively funky for a Lambic, though it does have a substantial acid quality to it.

The beer has a light fizziness to it, though it is not quite as low as a real ale.  Tart, yet somewhat clean up front; flavors of lemons, definite lactic and very dry, the cherry notes are certainly not omnipresent and in fact are almost more aromatic in character.  The beer finishes with a tannic structure and a slight astringency that is most likely from the cherries (pits & definite skin flavors), but also is likely contributed a bit by the barrels.  there is a certain flavor combination here that makes me think of cherry flavored childrens aspirin; it definitely has a certain medicinal / aspirin quality to it, especially up front.  Predominantly lactic in acid character, but it does have a touch of uriatic notes and hints of funky butyric acid.  While this is light and easy drinking, the tannins do add a certain fullness to the body that provide a nice texture.

A thoroughly enjoyable Kriek.  It could certainly have more carbonation, but I like the substantial, sourness as that is what I was looking forward too.  A touch more, well integrated funkiness would push this over that top.

Huge thanks to beastiefan2k for sharing this - cloudy dark pink/purple beer - salty, briny aroma, with undercurrents of cherry skins, like smokiness, acidic notes, and blue cheese funk - very sour and acidic up front (like a Cantillon sourness, but with more balance and drinkability) - strong tannic character - tangy - acidity subsides, as the beer gets briny and salty, and intense, aged cheese funk grabs a hold of the tongue - so very tasty.

UPDATED: JAN 8, 2008 Bottle Shared with Mr. Facto: Color is hazy pinkish-red, head is of average size, frothy and pink. Aroma is moderately yeasty and tart cherries. Flavor is very tart and acidic. Finish is long, very tart, moderately acidic, although more sweet than initially. Medium body, velvety texture, big carbonation.

UPDATED: FEB 6, 2009 750 ml bottle shared by Beastiefan2k.  Thanks Eugene!  Pours an almost murky bright reddish pink whith violet/purple highlights- almost looks like blood!  Aroma is sharp sour cherries, fleshy and pulpy, with some astringent pits and almond aromas.  As it warms more plasticy sharp phenols and weird esters come through with tons of funk- butyric and lactic acid- very horsey and almost wet dirty goat-like.  Insanely sharp acidic cherry skin flavors- sour all around- cherry pie and pedio character with more phenolic and solventy paint (reminded me somewhat of 3 fonteinenen oude kriek in that aspect). Harsh lactic sourness bordering on bile-like with a very tart and acidic finish.   Very complex and very sour.  I loved this beer!

UPDATED: JUN 4, 2008 750mL bottle from miketd, wow and thank you.  Its a very dark Kriek with dark pink and purple hues and a nice strong head. No clarity whatsoever.  The special thing about this Kriek is its very earthy and pity.  Seems like the pits take a lot here.  Makes it nicely nutty and musky.  The sourness is there obviously and the acidity is pretty subdued for an authentic kriek. 8/4/8/4/1703/2004 bottle pours with a pink quickly fading head and leaves no trace of a lacing.  Color is a dark cherry red with some translucent edges. Aroma is very tart dark cherries with very acidic tartness on the nose. Taste is extremely dry and a lot of the cherry taste has faded.  Acidity and lemon is rampant.  Some tart cherry can be picked up in the aftertaste. 9/4/8/3/16.375mL bottle @ t Brugs Beertje poured into a De Cam tumbler on 5/20/08.
user_location: HdG (past: NYC, KS, Rain City), Maryland, USA

text: Hazy red with small short lasting head. Sour aroma with narual cherries and barnyardy notes. Sour fruity flavor with typical brett notes, cherries and loads of tart character. Very nice and refreshing.

Generously shared by miketd.  Extreme sour aroma foreshadows whats coming soon.  Dark, hazy red with a light head.  Medium palate with good carbonation.  Tons of sourness in this--no cherry flavor at all--just nothing but straight out pucker.  Possibly the most sour beer Ive ever had along with Fou Foune.

Bottle shared by MikeTD: Pours a pinkish red with an off white head. Aroma, funky, cherry, some tartness. Flavor, tart, lots of funk, and intensely sour, some cherry in the background, dry funky finish, almost too sour. Almost.

Bottle from Hop Duvel, Gent, Belgium, had this 28-12-07  Poured looking a deep raspberry colour ony a tiny rim of bubbles for a head. Wonderful slightly aged sourness on the nose, and very much cherry. The cherry bite is there on first sip but its certainly not harsh, in fact its a softer acidic bite than I expected, but the sour cherry flavours are really stunning, a wonderful beer.

Bottle (375ml - green - corked & caged.  Purchased at UtoBeer, Borough Market, London.  Bottled 03.2004.  Poured thick, murky burgundy red, pretty much no head - 4-. Bottle. A red beer with a small pink head. The aroma is of cherries and light sour, the taste is light acid, sour cherries. Medium body with a very dry finish.

Bottle. Average reddish fizzy head that mostly diminished. Muddy red color. Spare lacework. Lovely mix of cherry and sour notes. Hint of barnyard, citrus, earth like. Medium to full bodied with an average carbonation and dry texture. Moderated sour flavor with light sweet notes. Sour cherry like lingering finish.

Bottle, 37,5 cl.
Very deep red color, with small pinkish head. Aroma cherries, sour. 
Medium body. Taste is sour, good cherries, very littte sweetness nice in balance with the lambic sourness. 
For me a very good Kriek !

UPDATED: NOV 29, 2007 2004 bottle and Delirium Cafe. Finally, a hugely sour, brutal and amazing lambic! We had 5 or 6 hard hitters before this, but this is definitely the star. Im sacrificing other bottles I was going to bring home for a big 750 of this stuff. I wish someone would convince these guys to bring their lambic to us desperate Americans!

UPDATED: JAN 5, 2008 37.5 cl bottle at Oude Arsenaal.  09/2004 bottling.  Bright red colour, lightly hazy.  Bright citric tartness immediately greets the nose, soft spiciness under the tartness.  Light horsey funk, but also a light dusty/mustiness.  Flavour is very bright and acidic.  The soft cherry pit spiciness is accented by all of the tartness.  Some almond and light cherry flavour throughout.  The body is light and creamy at the same time.  As it warms, the fruit and spice become even more apparent, integrating with the acidity and making it less apparent.  Great balance incredible brew.

Thanx to Boboski for sharing this delicious brew.Pours a beautiful bright red color with no head.Super sour cherries on the nose with some funk.I typically dont like these beers but this was exceptional.Lots of sour cherries and funk with a sour finish.

bottle courtesy of boboski:
pours a beautiful red pink with a pink thin line head. aroma is very funky with small amounts of the cherry but mostly sour funk. flavour is very tart and sour with some cherry that adds just enough sweetness to make the beer faontastic.

Courtesy boboski.  Pours a glorious red, with a medium light pink head.  Smells of light cherries, and huge acidity and sour notes.  I can tell this is gonna hit the cheeks hard.  Big funky nose. Cheers boboski!  Horsey, dry, feint sign of cherries in the aroma.  Pours beautiful red with a little pink on the outside.  Acidic, funk, funk funk, very feint sign of cherries in the flavor, tart finish with a little dryness.  So sour!  and so good!!!1

Courtesy boboski.  2005 bottle.  Pours a glowing scarlet with a thin white head that dissipates.  A ton of barnyard funk with some fruity notes way in the back.  Thin palate, effervescent. Courtesy boboski.  Pours a ruby red,   Aroma is funkadelic.  There is a touch of almond entertwined with the funk.  Some vinegar goodness.  Holy shit, this just might be the most sour beer I have ever tasted.  Damn.

Hazy magenta with a huge pink head that disappates within seconds to a thin ring of foam. Cherry juice, hay and dusty barnyard notes in the aroma. Very sour, mouth puckering cherry flavor. smelled like i ate a bunch of cherries and took a shit.  Aroma not so appealing, but the rest was nice.  Did become a little too tart for my buds toward the end of the glass, and started a churning in my stomach that made me question having another beer afterwards. [585-20070908] Bottle @ Sourfest 2007 (Buffalo, NY -- Vintage 2004, w/ rudolf, frylock, IPFreely, jerc, swoopjones). Soapy alcoholic cherry aroma. Murky pink, pink head.  Nose is peach pits, cherries, opak.  Flavor is acid, cherries, oak, lemon.  Tart fruity finish.  Hell yeah.

(375ml Bottle)  Pours a cloudy ruby body with a small pinkish tinged head.  Aroma of organic cherry sourness, earthiness, and light vinegar.  Flavor of ripe cherries with a subtle woodiness in the finish.

Bottle @ Rudolfs Sourfest. 2004 Vintage. Murky red body, with a big foamy pink head. (3 to 3+) Acidic lambicy aroma with light yeasty musty notes. 375 @ Rudolfs Sour Tasting with Rudolf, Jerc, IpFreely & Frylock. One of the best of the day. Deep red with pinkish head. Some wood, funk, & lots of sour tartness. Much more sour than the de ranke but enjoyable

375ml bottle, 2005 vintage. pours deep ruby red with pink head. nose is oaky, vinegar, tart cherries. flavor initially sour with ripe cherries, earthy, oaky, sharp tartness, wow, awesome, very refreshing, thirst quenching. exactly what you want in a kriek.

0.375 l bottle, bottled 2005, 6.5 %. Hazy red color. Strong juicy and sweet cherry aroma with some acidity and almonds. Much dryer but still very juicy flavor. Long, juicy, acidic and leathery finish.  Excellent aroma but too juicy and heavy flavor.

Bottled 375 ml, alc. 6.5% (vintage 2005)
Deep red, cherry-like color, no head, lively carbonation. Cellary, sour aroma with hints of barnyard. Bottle (375ml): Big pinkish foam, hazy reddish coloured, stronger sourish-cellary nose with a solid cherry aroma; extremely sour (presumably pH 1.5...) and tart flavour, light bodied; full Lambic character in the fruity-sour and tart finish. 2005. Absolutely stunning cloudy body, the brightest red light burning inside the glass. As wonderful as all the other components of the experience with this beer were, the appearance is what is most memorable. It looks thick but not syrupy, like bloody valentine cake. A thin, creamy but fizzy pink head formed atop the body and receded quickly and fully. The aroma is of melted cheery and cherry ice cream, with grassy hops that are fresh and alive, leather too. Schaerbeekse cherries appear to be the main, if not the only, variety used. Tons of funk, barnyard, horseblanket, all of the requisite off-the-wall traditional lambic nuances. Acidity is evident in the nose, long before the first sip; it makes my nostrils sting and flare. No noticeable alcohol. The flavor, remarkably complex, is of cherries that are as fresh as can be, with mild bitterness and grassy notes, light to moderate acidity and heavy creamy sweetness. No medicinal qualities whatsoever, always a constant fear lodged in the back of my mind when preparing to indulge in a red fruit beer. Tartness is medium, pockets of intense sourness and tannins at regular intervals. Acidity grows with each sip and keeps a balance between sweetness and bitterness. A few sips into it and tartness takes over. The finish is very clean and super refreshing, cherry pie filling and hop bitterness lingering, just lightly sour. I really wasnt expecting as large of a grassy hop profile, but it works wonders here. The mouthfeel is where most of the tartness does its damage, clinging to the sides of the mouth. Full bodied, very sticky, very soft and effervescent. Incredibly drinkable, what fun this was.

RSSG 2007 Overnight Tasting - Reddish pink, white fizzy head.  Intense nose of cherry, cheese, and funk.  Similar flavors from start to finish with loads of funky brett and aged cheddar, with lesser notes of horse blanket and cherry.  Medium bodied, medium carbonation, drying woody, lightly sour finish.  Very well done.  Thanks for sharing Bu11zeye

37.5 cL bottled in 2005. Poured a deep, dark burgundy with a small pink head. Huge aroma of wild cherries was slightly floral and only a touch sour. Sour, very juicy flavor of black cherries, quite acidic and lively, with a dry finish that begs you to follow it with another sip. Nearly wept with joy.

Bottle... RBSG 07... This beer rocks!... Murky crimson ale with a small, creamy, pink head. Aroma of cherries, nuts and graham crust. Highly acidic, fruity flavor with lots of cherries and sour, musty funk. Medium-bodied and astringent with prickly carbonation. Biting, bone-dry finish. Thanks to bu11zeye for sharing this world-class beer with us!

Very deep red for a lambic, with fine pinkish bubbles on top.  Evil-looking.  Smells like dried high-quality cherries, sour-aromas, slightly cheese-like.  Taste is sour funk, quality cherries, slight sweetness that is balanced perfectly by the lambic sourness.  Smooth full and round in the mouth.  This is the best Kriek Ive ever had yet!

Bottle @ 16th Weekend of Spontaneous Fermentation 2007, Opstal. Hazy medium red color with virtually none pink / off-white head. Aroma is light cherry sour. Light acidic flavour of berries and wood.
Tart finish.
Drunk it from bottle on tour de geuze at the brewery. A very nice and not so sweet but sure great kriek

6.5%, bottled (2005 vintage).  Sampled at Helsinki Beer Festival (Thanks to Tranquillity & his girlfriend for this one!). Hazy murky dark red colour with red/pink head, which goes away fast. Aroma is cherries, some vinegar and even other red berries. Flavour is quite the same. Richer than many other Krieks I have had. Excellent thing!

from belgianshop.com - totally cloudy, dark reddish colour, fast disappearing red/pink foam; deep aroma of cherries, vinegar and cheese; vinous; slightly oily, rather solid acidity; the finish is quite dry with notes of hay and cherries - a wonderful lambic !
UPDATED: MAR 31, 2008 Helsinki Beer Festival 2007. Aroma of raspberry and strawberry. Fantastic taste, bitter but fruity. Darker than usual kriek. Great!

Tasted at the woodshop tasting, maybe my favorite beer of the night, Lively large pink head, pale pink color, Very tart start, then some wood,and earth, a great brew....Great!!! Thanks to cquiroga for sharing!

Bottle thanks bu11zeye: Pours a deep blood red with a wispy pinkish head.  Aroma of earthy cheesy tart cherries with a touch of oak.  Body starts fairly viscous and oily without much sweetness but a lot of tart, fruity acidity.  Very dry, slightly funky finish.  A pretty nice kriek, but maybe a little too tart.

Poured a hazy cherry red color with minimal head.  Very complex aroma.  It has changed every time i sniffed it.  In all there was leather, horse, soil, metal, mint,  wood, and some tart cherry.  The flavor was dominated with tart cherry that became more acidic as it finished.  Mouth watering.  Sort of a silky mouthfeel.  Light to medium bodied.

Dark red colored, vanishing pink head. Aroma is, of course, dry with sour cherry tones, cherries come up very nicely with slight wooden touch. Mild bubblegum also there. Medium to full bodied. Cherries dominate also this even mildly alcoholic aroma, not very traditional lambic, maybe too much body for the style.

UPDATED: SEP 2, 2007 Bottle from Quinns in Camden, 6.5% abv. Id normally be embarassed to admit drinking a cherry beer, not this one! Pours an opaque cherry red with no head at all, from a rating standpoint its weakest feature. Sour cherry candy nose and taste (Jolly Rancher) with notes of yeast. Slightly salty but tart and tangy with a nice syrupy palate. Comes at you from all angles and will definately wake up any lazy tastebuds. Delicious, one of my favorites to date...

rbesg06, bottle at delirium. bright ruby colour with a slight pink head. aroma of sour apple, cobweb, sour cherry syrup. intense whack of sourness which reminded me that my teeth have fillings which i think is why i also tasted some aluminium foil. crazily sour and crazily good. thanks to magicdave6 and garethyoung for the sample (and a few others)

75 cl bottle, bottled in 2005. Shiny red with a dark pink hue. Fine but very thick cloudiness, volatile pink head. Lactic acid dominates the aroma, which also gives off some barnyard and fruit. A hint of the stones, too. Uncompromisingly sour taste with cherries and citrus around and behind. Very smooth, oily texture.
Bottled. Ruby red coloured with a rather large head. Nice and full flavour of berries (cherry). Very well balanced.

Opaque dark cherry body with no head to speak of.  Aroma is like walking into a cellar.  More sour than acid but with a cherry taste that remains under control (I dont like krieks with predominant cherry taste).  I dont think it goes through oak barrels but it tastes like it.  Some strawberry flavours in there too.  I wasnt impressed by the gueuze but the De Cam Kriek might just be the best of its kind that I ever had.  Another good reason why Belgium should be the next country we invade.

(Bottled) Very hazy ruby red color with almost no head. Tart, earthy, slightly sulphury, natural cherry aroma with low acidity and some salty seaweed. Very pleasant, dry and natural cherry flavor with lots of apples, lemon and acidity. Some sweetish cherry-peel in the finish. Medium-bodied, acidic palate with low carbonation. A very pleasant and natural kriek with high but tolerable (natural) acidity.

Draught - Bruxellensis Festival - A deep bright cherry red coloured beer with no head.  The aroma is sour and intensely fruity.  Lots of unsweetened cherry notes.  The taste is acidic.  Cherries again.  Smacking and mouth puckering.  Lambic burn.  Tasty and moreish.  Lovely stuff.

Please forgive me father for I have sinned. This is the absolute, the nasty, the beyond precognition depth of my demise, for I have forsaken you, amongst things, in imbibing in what is the clear path to hell. It is the elixir, it is sour as hell. But I repent... Forgive me, but I must imbibe again!. 
I know this one has nothing to do with religious sermon as does I, but holy, snapping dregs of beaten pillows (?) this was grandeur. I even needed the aid of a few Caol Ilas to recover the memories of my tasting this one.
Happy at a bottle of the best Gueuze money and spirited blenders could forfeit, I upon myself found this. An aged bottle not needed, at the t Brugs Beertje, Brugges, I had to have this fresh. Afore warned by one English speaking barman this was heavy, I retorted Yeah, umm, lovely, in a bottle, corked. I shall hold this til the naked hour, a glass I please!?! From that I, my wife include, ventured back to our haunted haunt and asked to be sole guests in its ghostly front room. The sun had reached its due and was receding behind the buildings of this old town. That was when the magic happened.
It erupted upon the cork freeing, a yeast burp that could knock an SS squad dead. After this release become layers of character, each nickling and tickling. Upper wafts of dead and dying funk, dank casks and cellar must - it is a Kriek, Im getting to that! - a very distinct odour of oxidised swarf in clean bins, straps of leather, fresh crimped and of course that fruit. This was tight, and by that I mean it creeped into the nostrils and tied my nose hairs together in an acidic challenge that bewildered me. The fruits attacked what was left. I loved it. Acidic, defined cherries absorbing whatever was left of the olfactories. Bugger it, there up for sale and this one bought them. What did it look like? If I cared it would be of some smoothy pureed at a health store . Nasty to look at, you cant lie. Ruby in colour, shades of pink roughage, no head unaided by the lack of carbonation. In the body held is so much fruit it is uncompromising and in the light opaque, this is Lambic Smoothie. The palate grips, tears and streams. It is light and yet easily sinks into overpowering. Tart beyond reconcile but so much in control. Wamm, bamm this is fruity. Upfront a heavy tickle, mid-palate holds tart and souring cherries like those you dare not touch and the apex reeks havoc. I loved it, it was all funk and junk, acid and sour cherries, goat hair and sweaty horse blanket, baby spew, soft cheese, exotic, malpicked, tart fruit. All can describe, all can lie. This was fantastic, bueno, lovely, complete. Became fruity as it ended phase young. Quite heavy, acidic as it delved into life after opening. I had my taste buds on high alert and still surrendered to this Beer upon beers. Absolutely lovely. Heaven and this!. The perfect Kriek, devilish is best!!! (37,5cL, 6.5% ABV, bottled 09/05)
Fruity as serious cherrys, a bit of funk too. Taste sismilar qith more funk than cherry, very carbonated and dry, excellent.
UPDATED: SEP 7, 2006 [Bottle from Delirium Cafe, Gothenburg] Big cherry aroma, barnyard aromas, rampant cheese and wood. Lively body and really sour. excellent.

A Mes rate: 37.5cl bottle from t Brugs Beertje. Very similar to Girardin Kriek in every way. Right down to the syrupy body. Outstanding tart and sour almost appley finish. Great stuff but not the best. Thick thick syrup for the last pour.

Bottled 09.2004, so almost two years in the bottle. The cork went off with a bang, and the initial head is huge, almost uncontrollable. It died down quickly. Red colour. Complex citrus and cherry nose with some mustiness. Great fruity flavours, the perfect marriage between the citrussy lambic and cherry. Almond and wood in the finish.Very fizzy. It must be one of the best krieks around.
Red in color with a pinkish large head that quickly disapates. Aroma of cherries,tart,acidic and musty. Flavor of sour cherries,musty,acidic and astringetn mouth puckering deliciousness.

This lambic ale poured with no head, eliciting a very cherry aroma. The flavor is sour but a little sweet and very very cherry. My drinking partner was given a bottle that was two years older, and I tried a few sips. It was a lot livelier (loud cork pop a much more head) and the flavor had mellowed considerably, balancing the cherry flavor with the yeast flavors. Both versions were excellent - perhaps the best kriek I have had.
3 years old bottle. Enormous pink head. Lots of yeast in the bottle. Dark reddish unclear body. Strong yeasty aroma, cherry, light alcohol. Strong sour flavour, some cherry sweetness in the finish.
Bottle. Pours a red colour with a pinkish head. Barnyard aroma with hints of cherries. Barnyard flavor with some nice flavor of cherries. Some sour mouthfeel and sour aftertaste.

37.5cl bottle from Dorstvlegel, Antwerp. Probably the most lively bottle Ive ever opened.  The cork bruised my lip as it exploded after I took the wire casing off.  "Bang!" indeed Kook.  Cloudy blood red with pinkish head.  Sour, funk and some cherry.  Probably the most lambieky of krieks Ive had.  Love the aroma.  Cherry isnt overpowering.  Still has the lemon of a lambic.  Will definitely have another

Bang! Huge pop and cork explosion upon opening. Red, very high carb body with a pink head. Nice glow to it. Musty rotting cherries, pear and farmyard aroma. Big acidic flavour. A bit over the top at times. Quite dusty with a subdued cherry flavour. Nice, but a bit too chalky.

Sour, funky nose, drainpipe-like, cherry too. Murky red color, fizzy spongy had. Full cherry body, very tart - puckering. Chalky end. Recalls Oud Bitje in that it stings the back of the throat. Nice one.

Vintage 2002: One of those beauties you could instantly slap yourself because you only bought one bottle in Belgium - well: Raspberry red color with a small film on top. Acidic, cobweb, pine and intense resin nose. Pockering cherry and spruce taste - dry and medium long lasting aftertaste. Wonderful!

vintage 2004, 375ml. hazy red bit brown, thin pink head. aromas of brett, horseblanket, bit cherries. tastes cheesy, sour, lactic, little balsemic vinager, hay and just a hint of cherries. finishes dry, tart, sour and very long...
wonderfull sour harshness, just great!
and oh, the cork almost took my head off...

Old Bourgundy wine color with almost no head. Aroma is soft and slight sharp at the same time. It has the softness of ripe cherries and accents of Pinot Noir. The sharp edges are vinegar like and show some lactic touches too. The taste is smooth for the style, the beer has a medium body and again hints of Old Bourgundy wine, cherrie-pits, ripe cherrie fruit, and some wood-branches.
The afthertaste is elegant and slight refreshing.

2002 bottle.  Deep cherry-pink in colour, lingering pink tinged head, small buibbles.  Aroma of cherries, musty, sour and acidic, some balsamic vinegar.  The flavour was of tart cherries, some balsamic vinegar, slightly acidic.  Pucker mouthfeel, medium body, soft carbonation.  Finishes dry, slightly sweet, lingering.  Very nice.

(2002 vintage bottle from Reading BF, UK).  My sort of kriek - gloriously sour, acidic and almondy which is oozing tradition - makes your tongue curl but in a nice way.  Dry, cherried, almondy and massively sour finish which lasts for hours.  Gorgeous.

375 ml bottle from 2002 shared at the Ratebeer Mondial gathering.  Bright pink-red, very cloudy with a bit of lasting head...sour farmy nose with subtle hints of cherry and dry hay...very soft mouthfeel, sourness throughout with subdued fruit acidity, fairly mouthpuckering finish, hints of sour apple...bit watery and clean in the end...acidity lingers.

My bottles label is different than the pic. It also says Kriek on it. Vintage 2002. Damn this is sour. Made my eyes twitch. Funky dirty wet dog taste towards the end. If this one gets almost a perfect score, I dont know if Geuze is for me. I finished it but it was tough.

Tart, dry, acidic aroma with typical horse blanket and burnt rubber phenols.  Opaque reddish body is covered with a fine-bubbled and lasting white head.  Very sour acidic and dry flavour paints the tongue with tart cherries and sweet balsamic vinegar.  Strong funk in the aftertaste.  Medium body with low carbonation and soft, gentle bubbles.  Enjoyed at the Ratebeer Mondial gathering 2005.

2002 bottle shared by Rastacouere at the Mondial Ratebeer tasting, 6/4/05.  Shining raspberry-cherry red colored body and a pink-tinged-white head fizzles away to a small ring.  Pale pink/cream on the edges of the glass.  Nose is tart and sour, you can smell the old musty, acidic cherry notes.  Light barnyard funk as well; wool clothes kept in the closet on a hot summer day.  Flavor is mint and vanilla with a short finish following a cherry mixed with lacto acidity at the start.  Flavorful, real sour cherries are tremendously flavorful.   Light grainy malt provides body, soft cheesey hops are evident.  Definitely old, funky and sour.  Mouthfeel is soft, with a low, easygoing natural carbonation.  Very dry here, no cheap sugaring agents in this.  My biggest complaint, after the wonderfully authentic start, is the relatively short finish, with not much flavor lingering.

UPDATED: JUN 13, 2005 Couleur rouge aux reflets allant vers lorangé, mousse blanche concassée.  Acidité tranchante et très prononcée en arome, agrumes, citronnée.  Lacidité et surtout le tarte sont très présente en bouche.  Acide, tartrique, quelques notes sauvages, couverture de cheval, quelques notes de fromage bleu.  On perd un peu la signature de la chaire du fruit en bouche, on dirait plus le noyau.  Aucune trace dalcool, belle présence en bouche, un brin de métal de détectable parmi la finale mi-sèche.

2002 bottle. Great white head covers a hazy great looking pink hue. Intense tart grapefruit nose. This is pretty much my definition of a blanket, smells sweaty and farmy, very horsey cherries. Beautiful funky nature, musty, earthy, leafy, phenomenal nose. Very very tart initial attack, bone-dry. Leafy greenish in mouth, very lemony, champaigny, soured cherry kernel. Very clean fermentation. Smooth bodied, mostly low carbonation despite an exploding cork. Salivating stuff literally, big thanks to Jeppe.

UPDATED: JUN 10, 2005 (Bottle 37,5 cl) The amazing Café Plan B in Copenhagen started importing several Belgian lambic-beers. I got to sneak a peak into their excellent beer-cellar and found a.o. this one from "De Cam". Very rose color. Even the head, which is very fizzy due to the high pressure in the bottle. Classic and completely un-sweetened "Kriek" with the traditional sensation of vinegar. The cherries add more color than aroma. The flavor almost disappears in the sourness. 020704

2002 bottle (labeled as 6.5% ABV), Waterhuis, Ghent, Nov 04.

Head is initially average sized, frothy, pink, mostly diminishing.
Body is hazy dark red, bottle conditioned.

Aroma is moderately yeasty (horseblanket), lightly malty (toasted grain), with notes of cherry and wood.

Flavor is moderately sweet, heavily acidic.
Finish is lightly sweet, moderately acidic, lightly bitter.

Medium body, velvety texture, fizzy carbonation, lightly astringent.

Awesome flavor balance, one of the better krieks Ive had.
Pours a red/amber hue with a small head.  Aroams of cherries, funk and more cherries.  Flavors of the same with a nice bitterness of the funk.
2002 bottle. Sour aroma with a hint of cherries. Nice deep red colour. Acidic flavour with some cherry notes.
Red color with a small slight off white head. The taste is sweet and fruity with a dominant cherry flavours. It finishes with a balanced yet sharp bitter or sour pattern.

Barnyard nose.
Red, stable pink and white head.
Dry fruit (cherry,citrus) and chalk.
Dark hazy red colour. Pink head. Sour and dry aroma with traces of cherries and wood. Very dry, sour and musty flavour. Oak, cherries, wood. Tart finish. Very good Kriek.
Dark red with large pink head. Musty, acidic, cherries, rhubarb, wood/pine.

Really dry and sour, which i was expecting, cherry stones. Full on dry sour attack, perhaps a little too much so, but still very good.
Bloody bright red note.  Very fruity.  Very tart, with a nutty finish.  Huge lambic goodness - full flavour, fairly clean, nutty and very refreshing.

Bottled: Reddish coloured. Unclear. Has a reddish dense head. Earth, fruit and sourness in the aroma. Light acidic. The taste is very sour. Almost draws all the moisture from your palate and ties a knot on your tongue. Just before it gets too much there is a slight fruitsweetness to balance the sourness. Quite remarkable. Has a very refreshing finish. This is really good.

Great tart cherry pie aroma, sweet. Cloudy cranberry red with light pink head. Watery palate with medium-high carbonation. Sour cherry start, chalky. Very tart, sour. Puckering finish, acidic after. Not for the faint-of-heart. Clean alum-tart after. Pretty good

The bottle opens with a flying cork, a loud bang and an angry wife. Cherry aroma, some oak and just a bit dusty. Nice mix between a cherry sweetness and some sourness with all the characteristics of a real kriek. Lemon, cherry pits, dust.  
Nice and relatively easy going traditional kriek. Good, but with some room for improvement.
Cloudy pink color, short head. Aroma is tart, fruity krieken, oak wood. Sweet kriek taste, some tartness, nice balance. Sour palate.

dutch ratebeer lambic-meeting. Fruity (cherries) aroma with oak and something quite smooth in it. Could be marzipan. Decent. Cloudy, red coloured with a short pink head. Taste is fruity (guess what... yess... cherries), oaky and tart. Good balanced. dry palate.
Aroma is oak, tart and a little cherry. Cloudy, red color, small pink head, fair lace. Sour, very fruity, light kriek, oak, dry. What a kriek! Wow!

UPDATED: SEP 14, 2008 Re-rate. Much better than the first time i tried this one, probably because back then i had 20 lambics in a row. Extremely fruity and complex, vinous, very sour finish. One of the best fruit lambics i know. God this stuff is good. Initial rating Dutch ratebeer lambic-meeting: Bottled in 2002. Cloudy red coloured, small head. Complex nose, fruit, oak and some tartness all in perfect harmony. Balanced flavour as well, oak, krieken. Good brew.

Colour like unfiltered strawberryjuice.
Acidic aroma with tones of soil, sweat and cherries.
Sour flavor with tones of strawberries, maraschino and cherries.

UPDATED: JUN 5, 2005 Edifying near-Cantillon-level acidity emboldened by a svelte mouthfeels hospitality...Defying cherry sweetness to wed a lemons sourness...The superb aroma of tart cherries somewhat lets down once tasted, as lemons takeover and displace that pulpous cherry...I would nonchalantly graze these fruity pastures for days on end...

Bottled. Cloudy bright red. with small pink head. Ripe cherries struggle to overpower grassy hops in th earoma. Initial syrupy cherry sweetness is turned into burning citric acidity. Clean mouthfeel. Well crafted, but lacks the sparkling, lively mouthfeel of the top examples of the style.

De Cam Oude KriekHazy, red (like blood) body.  Lots of carbonisation.  Pinkish head which disappears instantly.  heavily sour cherry aroma (probably from "Schaarbeekse krieken" (a sour cherry-variety).
It (the aroma) has a strong resemblance with the aroma of the Cantillon Kriek.  The flavour however is a little bit less sour than the Cantillons.  Moderately sour initial flavour.  Moderately sour, lightly sweet and fruity long finish.  Quite soft mouthfeel, little bit fizzy.  This is one of the best Krieks I ever tasted.

De Cam Oude KriekExplosive bottle; cloudy red color; big pink head. Nice aroma, of ripe cherries, and light aroma of kernels. Very uncommon mouthfeel, astringent and sour, but thin body; lemon juice, almost no cherries, no sweetness.

Bottle.  Thanks to Gazza for sharing this. Soft glowing dull pinky red appearance. Plastic, oak aroma. Initially mousse mouthfeel, but eventually settles (well, after Gazza has sat stirring it for half an hour) into a soft, puckering dryness with soft strawberry (not cherry) oaky flavours. Doesnt rock my boat.

Higly explosive cork, it almost took Unstrups ceiling down! Pours a tall and frothy pink head on a hazy cherry colored body - what a beauty! Vinous aroma, sour with cherry and some wood. Flavor is very tart and biding also with wood and obvious cherry notes. Dry. A very nice and tasteful Kriek!
Thanks to Jens (Ungstrup) for sharing!
[Mine was an Oude Kriek] An unclear red beer with no head. the aroma is sweet cherries. The flavor is dominated by cherries and wood and only slightly sour. It has a very dry and somewhat sour end.

Virtually no head. Clear-red beer. Vinous nose, fruity, not expressly cherry. Sour cherries in the taste, fresh fruit-like, not overly lambic-y. Yet very acidic. Very carbonated too - a bit too much even, the absence of head notwithstanding (rimes with the backgroundflavour of cherry-stones). Nice kriek - promessing. There was no label available, so no more details about age. Overwhelmingly good for such a young blender.
